line: The troops assent; their martial arms they change:

Poem Title: JUNO DECEIVES JUPITER BY THE GIRDLE OF VENUS.
line: The busy chiefs their banded legions range.

Poem Title: JUNO DECEIVES JUPITER BY THE GIRDLE OF VENUS.
line: The kings, though wounded, and oppress’d with pain,

Poem Title: JUNO DECEIVES JUPITER BY THE GIRDLE OF VENUS.
line: With helpful hands themselves assist the train.

Poem Title: JUNO DECEIVES JUPITER BY THE GIRDLE OF VENUS.
line: The strong and cumbrous arms the valiant wield,

Poem Title: JUNO DECEIVES JUPITER BY THE GIRDLE OF VENUS.
line: The weaker warrior takes a lighter shield.

Poem Title: JUNO DECEIVES JUPITER BY THE GIRDLE OF VENUS.
line: Thus sheath’d in shining brass, in bright array

Poem Title: JUNO DECEIVES JUPITER BY THE GIRDLE OF VENUS.
line: The legions march, and Neptune leads the way:

Poem Title: JUNO DECEIVES JUPITER BY THE GIRDLE OF VENUS.
line: His brandish’d falchion flames before their eyes,

Poem Title: JUNO DECEIVES JUPITER BY THE GIRDLE OF VENUS.
line: Like lightning flashing through the frighted skies.

Poem Title: JUNO DECEIVES JUPITER BY THE GIRDLE OF VENUS.
line: Clad in his might, the earth-shaking power appears;

Poem Title: JUNO DECEIVES JUPITER BY THE GIRDLE OF VENUS.
line: Pale mortals tremble, and confess their fears.

Poem Title: JUNO DECEIVES JUPITER BY THE GIRDLE OF VENUS.
JUNO DECEIVES JUPITER BY THE GIRDLE OF VENUS.
line: Troy’s great defender stands alone unawed,

Poem Title: JUNO DECEIVES JUPITER BY THE GIRDLE OF VENUS.
line: Arms his proud host, and dares oppose a god:

Poem Title: JUNO DECEIVES JUPITER BY THE GIRDLE OF VENUS.
line: And lo! the god, and wondrous man, appear:

Poem Title: JUNO DECEIVES JUPITER BY THE GIRDLE OF VENUS.
line: The sea’s stern ruler there, and Hector here.

Poem Title: JUNO DECEIVES JUPITER BY THE GIRDLE OF VENUS.
line: The roaring main, at her great master’s call,

Poem Title: JUNO DECEIVES JUPITER BY THE GIRDLE OF VENUS.
line: Rose in huge ranks, and form’d a watery wall

Poem Title: JUNO DECEIVES JUPITER BY THE GIRDLE OF VENUS.
line: Around the ships: seas hanging o’er the shores,

Poem Title: JUNO DECEIVES JUPITER BY THE GIRDLE OF VENUS.
line: Both armies join: earth thunders, ocean roars.

Poem Title: JUNO DECEIVES JUPITER BY THE GIRDLE OF VENUS.
line: Not half so loud the bellowing deeps resound,

Poem Title: JUNO DECEIVES JUPITER BY THE GIRDLE OF VENUS.
line: When stormy winds disclose the dark profound;

Poem Title: JUNO DECEIVES JUPITER BY THE GIRDLE OF VENUS.
line: Less loud the winds that from the Æolian hall

Poem Title: JUNO DECEIVES JUPITER BY THE GIRDLE OF VENUS.
line: Roar through the woods, and make whole forests fall;

Poem Title: JUNO DECEIVES JUPITER BY THE GIRDLE OF VENUS.
line: Less loud the woods, when flames in torrents pour,

Poem Title: JUNO DECEIVES JUPITER BY THE GIRDLE OF VENUS.
line: Catch the dry mountain, and its shades devour;

Poem Title: JUNO DECEIVES JUPITER BY THE GIRDLE OF VENUS.
line: With such a rage the meeting hosts are driven,

Poem Title: JUNO DECEIVES JUPITER BY THE GIRDLE OF VENUS.
line: And such a clamour shakes the sounding heaven.

Poem Title: JUNO DECEIVES JUPITER BY THE GIRDLE OF VENUS.
line: The first bold javelin, urged by Hector’s force,

Poem Title: JUNO DECEIVES JUPITER BY THE GIRDLE OF VENUS.
line: Direct at Ajax’ bosom winged its course;

Poem Title: JUNO DECEIVES JUPITER BY THE GIRDLE OF VENUS.
line: But there no pass the crossing belts afford,

Poem Title: JUNO DECEIVES JUPITER BY THE GIRDLE OF VENUS.
line: (One braced his shield, and one sustain’d his sword.)

Poem Title: JUNO DECEIVES JUPITER BY THE GIRDLE OF VENUS.
line: Then back the disappointed Trojan drew,

Poem Title: JUNO DECEIVES JUPITER BY THE GIRDLE OF VENUS.
line: And cursed the lance that unavailing flew:

Poem Title: JUNO DECEIVES JUPITER BY THE GIRDLE OF VENUS.
line: But ’scaped not Ajax; his tempestuous hand

Poem Title: JUNO DECEIVES JUPITER BY THE GIRDLE OF VENUS.
line: A ponderous stone upheaving from the sand,

Poem Title: JUNO DECEIVES JUPITER BY THE GIRDLE OF VENUS.
line: (Where heaps laid loose beneath the warrior’s feet,

Poem Title: JUNO DECEIVES JUPITER BY THE GIRDLE OF VENUS.
line: Or served to ballast, or to prop the fleet,)

Poem Title: JUNO DECEIVES JUPITER BY THE GIRDLE OF VENUS.
line: Toss’d round and round, the missive marble flings;

Poem Title: JUNO DECEIVES JUPITER BY THE GIRDLE OF VENUS.
line: On the razed shield the fallen ruin rings,

Poem Title: JUNO DECEIVES JUPITER BY THE GIRDLE OF VENUS.
line: Full on his breast and throat with force descends;

Poem Title: JUNO DECEIVES JUPITER BY THE GIRDLE OF VENUS.
line: Nor deaden’d there its giddy fury spends,

Poem Title: JUNO DECEIVES JUPITER BY THE GIRDLE OF VENUS.
line: But whirling on, with many a fiery round,

Poem Title: JUNO DECEIVES JUPITER BY THE GIRDLE OF VENUS.
line: Smokes in the dust, and ploughs into the ground.

Poem Title: JUNO DECEIVES JUPITER BY THE GIRDLE OF VENUS.
line: As when the bolt, red-hissing from above,

Poem Title: JUNO DECEIVES JUPITER BY THE GIRDLE OF VENUS.
line: Darts on the consecrated plant of Jove,

Poem Title: JUNO DECEIVES JUPITER BY THE GIRDLE OF VENUS.
line: The mountain-oak in flaming ruin lies,

Poem Title: JUNO DECEIVES JUPITER BY THE GIRDLE OF VENUS.
line: Black from the blow, and smokes of sulphur rise;

Poem Title: JUNO DECEIVES JUPITER BY THE GIRDLE OF VENUS.
line: Stiff with amaze the pale beholders stand,

Poem Title: JUNO DECEIVES JUPITER BY THE GIRDLE OF VENUS.
line: And own the terrors of the almighty hand!

Poem Title: JUNO DECEIVES JUPITER BY THE GIRDLE OF VENUS.
line: So lies great Hector prostrate on the shore;

Poem Title: JUNO DECEIVES JUPITER BY THE GIRDLE OF VENUS.
line: His slacken’d hand deserts the lance it bore;

Poem Title: JUNO DECEIVES JUPITER BY THE GIRDLE OF VENUS.
line: His following shield the fallen chief o’erspread;

Poem Title: JUNO DECEIVES JUPITER BY THE GIRDLE OF VENUS.
line: Beneath his helmet dropp’d his fainting head;

Poem Title: JUNO DECEIVES JUPITER BY THE GIRDLE OF VENUS.
line: His load of armour, sinking to the ground,

Poem Title: JUNO DECEIVES JUPITER BY THE GIRDLE OF VENUS.
line: Clanks on the field, a dead and hollow sound.

Poem Title: JUNO DECEIVES JUPITER BY THE GIRDLE OF VENUS.
line: Loud shouts of triumph fill the crowded plain;

Poem Title: JUNO DECEIVES JUPITER BY THE GIRDLE OF VENUS.
line: Greece sees, in hope, Troy’s great defender slain:

Poem Title: JUNO DECEIVES JUPITER BY THE GIRDLE OF VENUS.
line: All spring to seize him; storms of arrows fly,

Poem Title: JUNO DECEIVES JUPITER BY THE GIRDLE OF VENUS.
line: And thicker javelins intercept the sky.

Poem Title: JUNO DECEIVES JUPITER BY THE GIRDLE OF VENUS.
line: In vain an iron tempest hisses round;

Poem Title: JUNO DECEIVES JUPITER BY THE GIRDLE OF VENUS.
line: He lies protected, and without a wound.[238]

Poem Title: JUNO DECEIVES JUPITER BY THE GIRDLE OF VENUS.
line: Polydamas, Agenor the divine,

Poem Title: JUNO DECEIVES JUPITER BY THE GIRDLE OF VENUS.
line: The pious warrior of Anchises’ line,

Poem Title: JUNO DECEIVES JUPITER BY THE GIRDLE OF VENUS.
line: And each bold leader of the Lycian band,

Poem Title: JUNO DECEIVES JUPITER BY THE GIRDLE OF VENUS.
line: With covering shields (a friendly circle) stand,

Poem Title: JUNO DECEIVES JUPITER BY THE GIRDLE OF VENUS.
line: His mournful followers, with assistant care,

Poem Title: JUNO DECEIVES JUPITER BY THE GIRDLE OF VENUS.
line: The groaning hero to his chariot bear;

Poem Title: JUNO DECEIVES JUPITER BY THE GIRDLE OF VENUS.
line: His foaming coursers, swifter than the wind,

Poem Title: JUNO DECEIVES JUPITER BY THE GIRDLE OF VENUS.
line: Speed to the town, and leave the war behind.

Poem Title: JUNO DECEIVES JUPITER BY THE GIRDLE OF VENUS.
JUNO DECEIVES JUPITER BY THE GIRDLE OF VENUS.
line: When now they touch’d the mead’s enamell’d side,

Poem Title: JUNO DECEIVES JUPITER BY THE GIRDLE OF VENUS.
line: Where gentle Xanthus rolls his easy tide,

Poem Title: JUNO DECEIVES JUPITER BY THE GIRDLE OF VENUS.
line: With watery drops the chief they sprinkle round,

Poem Title: JUNO DECEIVES JUPITER BY THE GIRDLE OF VENUS.
line: Placed on the margin of the flowery ground.

Poem Title: JUNO DECEIVES JUPITER BY THE GIRDLE OF VENUS.
line: Raised on his knees, he now ejects the gore;

Poem Title: JUNO DECEIVES JUPITER BY THE GIRDLE OF VENUS.
line: Now faints anew, low-sinking on the shore;

Poem Title: JUNO DECEIVES JUPITER BY THE GIRDLE OF VENUS.
line: By fits he breathes, half views the fleeting skies,

Poem Title: JUNO DECEIVES JUPITER BY THE GIRDLE OF VENUS.
line: And seals again, by fits, his swimming eyes.

Poem Title: JUNO DECEIVES JUPITER BY THE GIRDLE OF VENUS.
JUNO DECEIVES JUPITER BY THE GIRDLE OF VENUS.
line: Soon as the Greeks the chief’s retreat beheld,

Poem Title: JUNO DECEIVES JUPITER BY THE GIRDLE OF VENUS.
line: With double fury each invades the field.

Poem Title: JUNO DECEIVES JUPITER BY THE GIRDLE OF VENUS.
line: Oilean Ajax first his javelin sped,

Poem Title: JUNO DECEIVES JUPITER BY THE GIRDLE OF VENUS.
line: Pierced by whose point the son of Enops bled;

Poem Title: JUNO DECEIVES JUPITER BY THE GIRDLE OF VENUS.
line: (Satnius the brave, whom beauteous Neis bore

Poem Title: JUNO DECEIVES JUPITER BY THE GIRDLE OF VENUS.
line: Amidst her flocks on Satnio’s silver shore;)

Poem Title: JUNO DECEIVES JUPITER BY THE GIRDLE OF VENUS.
line: Struck through the belly’s rim, the warrior lies

Poem Title: JUNO DECEIVES JUPITER BY THE GIRDLE OF VENUS.
line: Supine, and shades eternal veil his eyes.

Poem Title: JUNO DECEIVES JUPITER BY THE GIRDLE OF VENUS.
line: An arduous battle rose around the dead;

Poem Title: JUNO DECEIVES JUPITER BY THE GIRDLE OF VENUS.
line: By turns the Greeks, by turns the Trojans bled.

Poem Title: JUNO DECEIVES JUPITER BY THE GIRDLE OF VENUS.
JUNO DECEIVES JUPITER BY THE GIRDLE OF VENUS.
line: Fired with revenge, Polydamas drew near,

Poem Title: JUNO DECEIVES JUPITER BY THE GIRDLE OF VENUS.
line: And at Prothoënor shook the trembling spear;

Poem Title: JUNO DECEIVES JUPITER BY THE GIRDLE OF VENUS.
line: The driving javelin through his shoulder thrust,

Poem Title: JUNO DECEIVES JUPITER BY THE GIRDLE OF VENUS.
line: He sinks to earth, and grasps the bloody dust.

Poem Title: JUNO DECEIVES JUPITER BY THE GIRDLE OF VENUS.
line: “Lo thus (the victor cries) we rule the field,

Poem Title: JUNO DECEIVES JUPITER BY THE GIRDLE OF VENUS.
line: And thus their arms the race of Panthus wield:

Poem Title: JUNO DECEIVES JUPITER BY THE GIRDLE OF VENUS.
line: From this unerring hand there flies no dart

Poem Title: JUNO DECEIVES JUPITER BY THE GIRDLE OF VENUS.
line: But bathes its point within a Grecian heart.

Poem Title: JUNO DECEIVES JUPITER BY THE GIRDLE OF VENUS.
line: Propp’d on that spear to which thou owest thy fall,

Poem Title: JUNO DECEIVES JUPITER BY THE GIRDLE OF VENUS.
line: Go, guide thy darksome steps to Pluto’s dreary hall.”

Poem Title: JUNO DECEIVES JUPITER BY THE GIRDLE OF VENUS.
JUNO DECEIVES JUPITER BY THE GIRDLE OF VENUS.
line: He said, and sorrow touch’d each Argive breast:

Poem Title: JUNO DECEIVES JUPITER BY THE GIRDLE OF VENUS.
line: The soul of Ajax burn’d above the rest.

Poem Title: JUNO DECEIVES JUPITER BY THE GIRDLE OF VENUS.
line: As by his side the groaning warrior fell,

Poem Title: JUNO DECEIVES JUPITER BY THE GIRDLE OF VENUS.
line: At the fierce foe he launch’d his piercing steel;

Poem Title: JUNO DECEIVES JUPITER BY THE GIRDLE OF VENUS.
line: The foe, reclining, shunn’d the flying death;

Poem Title: JUNO DECEIVES JUPITER BY THE GIRDLE OF VENUS.
line: But fate, Archilochus, demands thy breath:

Poem Title: JUNO DECEIVES JUPITER BY THE GIRDLE OF VENUS.
line: Thy lofty birth no succour could impart,

Poem Title: JUNO DECEIVES JUPITER BY THE GIRDLE OF VENUS.
line: The wings of death o’ertook thee on the dart;

Poem Title: JUNO DECEIVES JUPITER BY THE GIRDLE OF VENUS.
line: Swift to perform heaven’s fatal will, it fled

Poem Title: JUNO DECEIVES JUPITER BY THE GIRDLE OF VENUS.
line: Full on the juncture of the neck and head,

Poem Title: JUNO DECEIVES JUPITER BY THE GIRDLE OF VENUS.
line: And took the joint, and cut the nerves in twain:

Poem Title: JUNO DECEIVES JUPITER BY THE GIRDLE OF VENUS.
line: The dropping head first tumbled on the plain.

Poem Title: JUNO DECEIVES JUPITER BY THE GIRDLE OF VENUS.
line: So just the stroke, that yet the body stood

Poem Title: JUNO DECEIVES JUPITER BY THE GIRDLE OF VENUS.
line: Erect, then roll’d along the sands in blood.

Poem Title: JUNO DECEIVES JUPITER BY THE GIRDLE OF VENUS.
JUNO DECEIVES JUPITER BY THE GIRDLE OF VENUS.
line: “Here, proud Polydamas, here turn thy eyes!

Poem Title: JUNO DECEIVES JUPITER BY THE GIRDLE OF VENUS.
line: (The towering Ajax loud-insulting cries:)

Poem Title: JUNO DECEIVES JUPITER BY THE GIRDLE OF VENUS.
line: Say, is this chief extended on the plain

Poem Title: JUNO DECEIVES JUPITER BY THE GIRDLE OF VENUS.
line: A worthy vengeance for Prothoënor slain?

Poem Title: JUNO DECEIVES JUPITER BY THE GIRDLE OF VENUS.
line: Mark well his port! his figure and his face

Poem Title: JUNO DECEIVES JUPITER BY THE GIRDLE OF VENUS.
line: Nor speak him vulgar, nor of vulgar race;

Poem Title: JUNO DECEIVES JUPITER BY THE GIRDLE OF VENUS.
line: Some lines, methinks, may make his lineage known,

Poem Title: JUNO DECEIVES JUPITER BY THE GIRDLE OF VENUS.
line: Antenor’s brother, or perhaps his son.”

Poem Title: JUNO DECEIVES JUPITER BY THE GIRDLE OF VENUS.
JUNO DECEIVES JUPITER BY THE GIRDLE OF VENUS.
line: He spake, and smiled severe, for well he knew

Poem Title: JUNO DECEIVES JUPITER BY THE GIRDLE OF VENUS.
line: The bleeding youth: Troy sadden’d at the view.

Poem Title: JUNO DECEIVES JUPITER BY THE GIRDLE OF VENUS.
line: But furious Acamas avenged his cause;

Poem Title: JUNO DECEIVES JUPITER BY THE GIRDLE OF VENUS.
line: As Promachus his slaughtered brother draws,

Poem Title: JUNO DECEIVES JUPITER BY THE GIRDLE OF VENUS.
line: He pierced his heart—“Such fate attends you all,

Poem Title: JUNO DECEIVES JUPITER BY THE GIRDLE OF VENUS.
line: Proud Argives! destined by our arms to fall.

Poem Title: JUNO DECEIVES JUPITER BY THE GIRDLE OF VENUS.
line: Not Troy alone, but haughty Greece, shall share

Poem Title: JUNO DECEIVES JUPITER BY THE GIRDLE OF VENUS.
line: The toils, the sorrows, and the wounds of war.

Poem Title: JUNO DECEIVES JUPITER BY THE GIRDLE OF VENUS.
line: Behold your Promachus deprived of breath,

Poem Title: JUNO DECEIVES JUPITER BY THE GIRDLE OF VENUS.
line: A victim owed to my brave brother’s death.

Poem Title: JUNO DECEIVES JUPITER BY THE GIRDLE OF VENUS.
line: Not unappeased he enters Pluto’s gate,

Poem Title: JUNO DECEIVES JUPITER BY THE GIRDLE OF VENUS.
line: Who leaves a brother to revenge his fate.”

Poem Title: JUNO DECEIVES JUPITER BY THE GIRDLE OF VENUS.
JUNO DECEIVES JUPITER BY THE GIRDLE OF VENUS.
line: Heart-piercing anguish struck the Grecian host,

line: But touch’d the breast of bold Peneleus most;

Poem Title: JUNO DECEIVES JUPITER BY THE GIRDLE OF VENUS.
line: At the proud boaster he directs his course;

line: The boaster flies, and shuns superior force.

Poem Title: JUNO DECEIVES JUPITER BY THE GIRDLE OF VENUS.
line: But young Ilioneus received the spear;

Poem Title: JUNO DECEIVES JUPITER BY THE GIRDLE OF VENUS.
line: Ilioneus, his father’s only care:

Poem Title: JUNO DECEIVES JUPITER BY THE GIRDLE OF VENUS.
line: (Phorbas the rich, of all the Trojan train

Poem Title: JUNO DECEIVES JUPITER BY THE GIRDLE OF VENUS.
line: Whom Hermes loved, and taught the arts of gain:)

Poem Title: JUNO DECEIVES JUPITER BY THE GIRDLE OF VENUS.
line: Full in his eye the weapon chanced to fall,

Poem Title: JUNO DECEIVES JUPITER BY THE GIRDLE OF VENUS.
line: And from the fibres scoop’d the rooted ball,

Poem Title: JUNO DECEIVES JUPITER BY THE GIRDLE OF VENUS.
line: Drove through the neck, and hurl’d him to the plain;

line: Apollo bows, and from mount Ida’s height,

line: And with perfumes of sweet ambrosial dews

line: Restores his freshness, and his form renews.

line: Of matchless swiftness, but of silent pace,

line: Received Sarpedon, at the god’s command,

Poem Title: LYCIA
line: And in a moment reach’d the Lycian land;

line: The corse amidst his weeping friends they laid,

line: Where endless honours wait the sacred shade.

line: Meanwhile Patroclus pours along the plains,

Poem Title: LYCIA
line: With foaming coursers, and with loosen’d reins.

Poem Title: LYCIA
line: Fierce on the Trojan and the Lycian crew,

Poem Title: LYCIA
line: Ah blind to fate! thy headlong fury flew:

Poem Title: LYCIA
line: Against what fate and powerful Jove ordain,

Poem Title: LYCIA
line: Vain was thy friend’s command, thy courage vain.

Poem Title: LYCIA
line: For he, the god, whose counsels uncontroll’d

Poem Title: LYCIA
line: Dismay the mighty, and confound the bold;

Poem Title: LYCIA
line: The god who gives, resumes, and orders all,

Poem Title: LYCIA
line: He urged thee on, and urged thee on to fall.

LYCIA
line: Who first, brave hero! by that arm was slain,

Poem Title: LYCIA
line: Who last beneath thy vengeance press’d the plain;

Poem Title: LYCIA
line: When heaven itself thy fatal fury led,

Poem Title: LYCIA
line: And call’d to fill the number of the dead?

line: Adrestus first; Autonous then succeeds;

line: Echeclus follows; next young Megas bleeds,

line: Epistor, Melanippus, bite the ground;

line: The slaughter, Elasus and Mulius crown’d:

line: The rest, dispersing, trust their fates to flight.

line: Now Troy had stoop’d beneath his matchless power,

Poem Title: LYCIA
line: But flaming Phœbus kept the sacred tower.

line: Thrice at the battlements Patroclus strook;[246]

line: He tried the fourth; when, bursting from the cloud,

line: A more than mortal voice was heard aloud.

LYCIA
line: “Patroclus! cease; this heaven-defended wall

line: Defies thy lance; not fated yet to fall;

Poem Title: LYCIA
line: Thy friend, thy greater far, it shall withstand,

Poem Title: LYCIA
line: Troy shall not stoop even to Achilles’ hand.”

Poem Title: LYCIA
LYCIA
line: So spoke the god who darts celestial fires;

Poem Title: LYCIA
line: The Greek obeys him, and with awe retires.

Poem Title: LYCIA
line: While Hector, checking at the Scæan gates

line: His panting coursers, in his breast debates,

line: Or in the field his forces to employ,

line: Thus while he thought, beside him Phœbus stood,

Poem Title: LYCIA
line: In Asius’ shape, who reigned by Sangar’s flood;

Poem Title: LYCIA
line: (Thy brother, Hecuba! from Dymas sprung,

Poem Title: LYCIA
line: A valiant warrior, haughty, bold, and young;)

Poem Title: LYCIA
line: Thus he accosts him. “What a shameful sight!

line: God! is it Hector that forbears the fight?

line: Were thine my vigour this successful spear

Poem Title: LYCIA
line: Should soon convince thee of so false a fear.

line: Turn thee, ah turn thee to the field of fame,

Poem Title: LYCIA
line: And in Patroclus’ blood efface thy shame.

Poem Title: LYCIA
line: Perhaps Apollo shall thy arms succeed,

Poem Title: LYCIA
line: And heaven ordains him by thy lance to bleed.”

line: So spoke the inspiring god; then took his flight,

Poem Title: LYCIA
line: And plunged amidst the tumult of the fight.

line: He bids Cebrion drive the rapid car;

line: The lash resounds, the coursers rush to war.

line: The god the Grecians’ sinking souls depress’d,

Poem Title: LYCIA
line: And pour’d swift spirits through each Trojan breast.

line: Patroclus lights, impatient for the fight;

Poem Title: LYCIA
line: A spear his left, a stone employs his right:

Poem Title: LYCIA
line: With all his nerves he drives it at the foe.

Poem Title: LYCIA
line: Pointed above, and rough and gross below:

Poem Title: LYCIA
line: The falling ruin crush’d Cebrion’s head,

Poem Title: LYCIA
line: The lawless offspring of king Priam’s bed;

line: His front, brows, eyes, one undistinguish’d wound:

line: The bursting balls drop sightless to the ground.

line: The charioteer, while yet he held the rein,

line: To the dark shades the soul unwilling glides,

Poem Title: LYCIA

LYCIA
line: “Good heaven! what active feats yon artist shows!

line: Pity that all their practice is by land!”

line: Then rushing sudden on his prostrate prize,

Poem Title: LYCIA
line: Swift as a lion, terrible and bold,

Poem Title: LYCIA
line: That sweeps the field, depopulates the fold;

Poem Title: LYCIA
line: Pierced through the dauntless heart, then tumbles slain,

Poem Title: LYCIA
line: And from his fatal courage finds his bane.

Poem Title: LYCIA
line: At once bold Hector leaping from his car,

Poem Title: LYCIA
line: Defends the body, and provokes the war.

Poem Title: LYCIA
line: Thus for some slaughter’d hind, with equal rage,

Poem Title: LYCIA
line: Two lordly rulers of the wood engage;

Poem Title: LYCIA
line: Stung with fierce hunger, each the prey invades,

Poem Title: LYCIA
line: And echoing roars rebellow through the shades.

Poem Title: LYCIA
line: Stern Hector fastens on the warrior’s head,

Poem Title: LYCIA
line: And by the foot Patroclus drags the dead:

Poem Title: LYCIA
line: While all around, confusion, rage, and fright,

line: Mix the contending hosts in mortal fight.

Poem Title: LYCIA
line: So pent by hills, the wild winds roar aloud

Poem Title: LYCIA
line: In the deep bosom of some gloomy wood;

line: Leaves, arms, and trees, aloft in air are blown,

Poem Title: LYCIA
line: The broad oaks crackle, and the Sylvans groan;

Poem Title: LYCIA
line: This way and that, the rattling thicket bends,

Poem Title: LYCIA
line: And the whole forest in one crash descends.

Poem Title: LYCIA
line: Not with less noise, with less tumultuous rage,

Poem Title: LYCIA
line: In dreadful shock the mingled hosts engage.

Poem Title: LYCIA
line: Darts shower’d on darts, now round the carcase ring;

Poem Title: LYCIA
line: Now flights of arrows bounding from the string:

Poem Title: LYCIA
line: Stones follow stones; some clatter on the fields,

line: Some hard, and heavy, shake the sounding shields.

Poem Title: LYCIA
line: But where the rising whirlwind clouds the plains,

line: Sunk in soft dust the mighty chief remains,

line: And, stretch’d in death, forgets the guiding reins!

line: Now flaming from the zenith, Sol had driven

line: His fervid orb through half the vault of heaven;

line: While on each host with equal tempests fell

line: The showering darts, and numbers sank to hell.

line: But when his evening wheels o’erhung the main,

line: Glad conquest rested on the Grecian train.

line: Then from amidst the tumult and alarms,

line: They draw the conquer’d corse and radiant arms.

line: Then rash Patroclus with new fury glows,

line: And breathing slaughter, pours amid the foes.

line: Thrice on the press like Mars himself he flew,

line: And thrice three heroes at each onset slew.

line: There ends thy glory! there the Fates untwine

line: The last, black remnant of so bright a line:

line: Apollo dreadful stops thy middle way;

line: Death calls, and heaven allows no longer day!

line: For lo! the god in dusky clouds enshrined,

line: Approaching dealt a staggering blow behind.

line: The weighty shock his neck and shoulders feel;

line: His eyes flash sparkles, his stunn’d senses reel

line: In giddy darkness; far to distance flung,

line: His bounding helmet on the champaign rung.

line: Achilles’ plume is stain’d with dust and gore;

line: That plume which never stoop’d to earth before;

Poem Title: LYCIA
line: Long used, untouch’d, in fighting fields to shine,

Poem Title: LYCIA
line: And shade the temples of the mad divine.

Poem Title: LYCIA
line: Jove dooms it now on Hector’s helm to nod;

line: His spear in shivers falls; his ample shield

line: Stupid he stares, and all-assistless stands:

line: A Dardan youth there was, well known to fame,

line: From Panthus sprung, Euphorbus was his name;

line: Famed for the manage of the foaming horse,

Poem Title: LYCIA
line: Skill’d in the dart, and matchless in the course:

line: Full twenty knights he tumbled from the car,

Poem Title: LYCIA
line: While yet he learn’d his rudiments of war.

Poem Title: LYCIA
line: His venturous spear first drew the hero’s gore;

Poem Title: LYCIA
line: He struck, he wounded, but he durst no more.

Poem Title: LYCIA
line: Nor, though disarm’d, Patroclus’ fury stood:

line: But swift withdrew the long-protended wood.

line: And turn’d him short, and herded in the crowd.

line: Thus, by an arm divine, and mortal spear,

line: Wounded, at once, Patroclus yields to fear,

line: Retires for succour to his social train,

line: Stern Hector, as the bleeding chief he views,

line: Breaks through the ranks, and his retreat pursues:

line: The lance arrests him with a mortal wound;

line: With him all Greece was sunk; that moment all

line: Her yet-surviving heroes seem’d to fall.

line: So, scorch’d with heat, along the desert score,

line: The roaming lion meets a bristly boar,

line: With flaming eyes, and jaws besmear’d with blood;

line: Patroclus thus, so many chiefs o’erthrown,

line: As dying now at Hector’s feet he lies,

line: He sternly views him, and triumphant cries:

line: “Lie there, Patroclus! and with thee, the joy

line: Thy pride once promised, of subverting Troy;

line: The fancied scenes of Ilion wrapt in flames,

line: And thy soft pleasures served with captive dames.

line: Unthinking man! I fought those towers to free,

line: But thou a prey to vultures shalt be made;

line: Though much at parting that great chief might say,

line: And much enjoin thee, this important day.

line: ‘Return not, my brave friend (perhaps he said),

line: Without the bloody arms of Hector dead.’

Poem Title: LYCIA
line: He spoke, Patroclus march’d, and thus he sped.”

LYCIA
line: Supine, and wildly gazing on the skies,

Poem Title: LYCIA
line: With faint, expiring breath, the chief replies:

Poem Title: LYCIA

line: “Vain boaster! cease, and know the powers divine!

Poem Title: LYCIA
line: Jove’s and Apollo’s is this deed, not thine;

Poem Title: LYCIA
line: To heaven is owed whate’er your own you call,

Poem Title: LYCIA
line: And heaven itself disarm’d me ere my fall.

Poem Title: LYCIA
line: Had twenty mortals, each thy match in might,

Poem Title: LYCIA
line: Opposed me fairly, they had sunk in fight:

Poem Title: LYCIA
line: By fate and Phœbus was I first o’erthrown,

Poem Title: LYCIA
line: Euphorbus next; the third mean part thy own.

line: But thou, imperious! hear my latest breath;

line: The gods inspire it, and it sounds thy death:

Poem Title: LYCIA
line: Insulting man, thou shalt be soon as I;

Poem Title: LYCIA
line: Black fate o’erhangs thee, and thy hour draws nigh;

line: Even now on life’s last verge I see thee stand,

Poem Title: LYCIA
line: I see thee fall, and by Achilles’ hand.”

Poem Title: LYCIA
LYCIA
line: He faints: the soul unwilling wings her way,

Poem Title: LYCIA
line: (The beauteous body left a load of clay)

Poem Title: LYCIA
line: Flits to the lone, uncomfortable coast;

Poem Title: LYCIA
line: A naked, wandering, melancholy ghost!

Poem Title: LYCIA
LYCIA
line: Then Hector pausing, as his eyes he fed

Poem Title: LYCIA
line: On the pale carcase, thus address’d the dead:

Poem Title: LYCIA
LYCIA
line: “From whence this boding speech, the stern decree

Poem Title: LYCIA
line: Of death denounced, or why denounced to me?

Poem Title: LYCIA
line: Why not as well Achilles’ fate be given

Poem Title: LYCIA
line: To Hector’s lance? Who knows the will of heaven?”

Poem Title: LYCIA
LYCIA
line: Pensive he said; then pressing as he lay

Poem Title: LYCIA
line: His breathless bosom, tore the lance away;

Poem Title: LYCIA
line: And upwards cast the corse: the reeking spear

Poem Title: LYCIA
line: He shakes, and charges the bold charioteer.

Poem Title: LYCIA
line: But swift Automedon with loosen’d reins

Poem Title: LYCIA
line: Rapt in the chariot o’er the distant plains,

Poem Title: LYCIA
line: Far from his rage the immortal coursers drove;

Poem Title: LYCIA
line: The immortal coursers were the gift of Jove.

line: And bade the public and the laws decide:

Poem Title: THE GRIEF OF ACHILLES, AND NEW ARMOUR MADE HIM BY VULCAN.
line: The witness is produced on either hand:

Poem Title: THE GRIEF OF ACHILLES, AND NEW ARMOUR MADE HIM BY VULCAN.
line: For this, or that, the partial people stand:

Poem Title: THE GRIEF OF ACHILLES, AND NEW ARMOUR MADE HIM BY VULCAN.
line: The appointed heralds still the noisy bands,

Poem Title: THE GRIEF OF ACHILLES, AND NEW ARMOUR MADE HIM BY VULCAN.
line: And form a ring, with sceptres in their hands:

Poem Title: THE GRIEF OF ACHILLES, AND NEW ARMOUR MADE HIM BY VULCAN.
line: On seats of stone, within the sacred place,[254]

Poem Title: THE GRIEF OF ACHILLES, AND NEW ARMOUR MADE HIM BY VULCAN.
line: The reverend elders nodded o’er the case;

Poem Title: THE GRIEF OF ACHILLES, AND NEW ARMOUR MADE HIM BY VULCAN.
line: Alternate, each the attesting sceptre took,

Poem Title: THE GRIEF OF ACHILLES, AND NEW ARMOUR MADE HIM BY VULCAN.
line: And rising solemn, each his sentence spoke.

Poem Title: THE GRIEF OF ACHILLES, AND NEW ARMOUR MADE HIM BY VULCAN.
line: Two golden talents lay amidst, in sight,

Poem Title: THE GRIEF OF ACHILLES, AND NEW ARMOUR MADE HIM BY VULCAN.
line: The prize of him who best adjudged the right.

Poem Title: THE GRIEF OF ACHILLES, AND NEW ARMOUR MADE HIM BY VULCAN.
THE GRIEF OF ACHILLES, AND NEW ARMOUR MADE HIM BY VULCAN.
line: Another part (a prospect differing far)[255]

Poem Title: THE GRIEF OF ACHILLES, AND NEW ARMOUR MADE HIM BY VULCAN.
line: Glow’d with refulgent arms, and horrid war.

Poem Title: THE GRIEF OF ACHILLES, AND NEW ARMOUR MADE HIM BY VULCAN.
line: Two mighty hosts a leaguer’d town embrace,

Poem Title: THE GRIEF OF ACHILLES, AND NEW ARMOUR MADE HIM BY VULCAN.
line: And one would pillage, one would burn the place.

Poem Title: THE GRIEF OF ACHILLES, AND NEW ARMOUR MADE HIM BY VULCAN.
line: Meantime the townsmen, arm’d with silent care,

Poem Title: THE GRIEF OF ACHILLES, AND NEW ARMOUR MADE HIM BY VULCAN.
line: A secret ambush on the foe prepare:

Poem Title: THE GRIEF OF ACHILLES, AND NEW ARMOUR MADE HIM BY VULCAN.
line: Their wives, their children, and the watchful band

Poem Title: THE GRIEF OF ACHILLES, AND NEW ARMOUR MADE HIM BY VULCAN.
line: Of trembling parents, on the turrets stand.

Poem Title: THE GRIEF OF ACHILLES, AND NEW ARMOUR MADE HIM BY VULCAN.
line: They march; by Pallas and by Mars made bold:

Poem Title: THE GRIEF OF ACHILLES, AND NEW ARMOUR MADE HIM BY VULCAN.
line: Gold were the gods, their radiant garments gold,

Poem Title: THE GRIEF OF ACHILLES, AND NEW ARMOUR MADE HIM BY VULCAN.
line: And gold their armour: these the squadron led,

Poem Title: THE GRIEF OF ACHILLES, AND NEW ARMOUR MADE HIM BY VULCAN.
line: August, divine, superior by the head!

Poem Title: THE GRIEF OF ACHILLES, AND NEW ARMOUR MADE HIM BY VULCAN.
line: A place for ambush fit they found, and stood,

Poem Title: THE GRIEF OF ACHILLES, AND NEW ARMOUR MADE HIM BY VULCAN.
line: Cover’d with shields, beside a silver flood.

Poem Title: THE GRIEF OF ACHILLES, AND NEW ARMOUR MADE HIM BY VULCAN.
line: Two spies at distance lurk, and watchful seem

Poem Title: THE GRIEF OF ACHILLES, AND NEW ARMOUR MADE HIM BY VULCAN.
line: If sheep or oxen seek the winding stream.

Poem Title: THE GRIEF OF ACHILLES, AND NEW ARMOUR MADE HIM BY VULCAN.
line: Soon the white flocks proceeded o’er the plains,

Poem Title: THE GRIEF OF ACHILLES, AND NEW ARMOUR MADE HIM BY VULCAN.
line: And steers slow-moving, and two shepherd swains;

Poem Title: THE GRIEF OF ACHILLES, AND NEW ARMOUR MADE HIM BY VULCAN.
line: Behind them piping on their reeds they go,

Poem Title: THE GRIEF OF ACHILLES, AND NEW ARMOUR MADE HIM BY VULCAN.
line: Nor fear an ambush, nor suspect a foe.

Poem Title: THE GRIEF OF ACHILLES, AND NEW ARMOUR MADE HIM BY VULCAN.
line: In arms the glittering squadron rising round

Poem Title: THE GRIEF OF ACHILLES, AND NEW ARMOUR MADE HIM BY VULCAN.
line: Rush sudden; hills of slaughter heap the ground;

Poem Title: THE GRIEF OF ACHILLES, AND NEW ARMOUR MADE HIM BY VULCAN.
line: Whole flocks and herds lie bleeding on the plains,

Poem Title: THE GRIEF OF ACHILLES, AND NEW ARMOUR MADE HIM BY VULCAN.
line: And, all amidst them, dead, the shepherd swains!

Poem Title: THE GRIEF OF ACHILLES, AND NEW ARMOUR MADE HIM BY VULCAN.
line: The bellowing oxen the besiegers hear;

Poem Title: THE GRIEF OF ACHILLES, AND NEW ARMOUR MADE HIM BY VULCAN.
line: They rise, take horse, approach, and meet the war,

Poem Title: THE GRIEF OF ACHILLES, AND NEW ARMOUR MADE HIM BY VULCAN.
line: They fight, they fall, beside the silver flood;

Poem Title: THE GRIEF OF ACHILLES, AND NEW ARMOUR MADE HIM BY VULCAN.
line: The waving silver seem’d to blush with blood.

Poem Title: THE GRIEF OF ACHILLES, AND NEW ARMOUR MADE HIM BY VULCAN.
line: There Tumult, there Contention stood confess’d;

Poem Title: THE GRIEF OF ACHILLES, AND NEW ARMOUR MADE HIM BY VULCAN.
line: One rear’d a dagger at a captive’s breast;

Poem Title: THE GRIEF OF ACHILLES, AND NEW ARMOUR MADE HIM BY VULCAN.
line: One held a living foe, that freshly bled

Poem Title: THE GRIEF OF ACHILLES, AND NEW ARMOUR MADE HIM BY VULCAN.
line: With new-made wounds; another dragg’d a dead;

Poem Title: THE GRIEF OF ACHILLES, AND NEW ARMOUR MADE HIM BY VULCAN.
line: Now here, now there, the carcases they tore:

Poem Title: THE GRIEF OF ACHILLES, AND NEW ARMOUR MADE HIM BY VULCAN.
line: Fate stalk’d amidst them, grim with human gore.

Poem Title: THE GRIEF OF ACHILLES, AND NEW ARMOUR MADE HIM BY VULCAN.
line: And the whole war came out, and met the eye;

Poem Title: THE GRIEF OF ACHILLES, AND NEW ARMOUR MADE HIM BY VULCAN.
line: And each bold figure seem’d to live or die.

Poem Title: THE GRIEF OF ACHILLES, AND NEW ARMOUR MADE HIM BY VULCAN.
THE GRIEF OF ACHILLES, AND NEW ARMOUR MADE HIM BY VULCAN.
line: A field deep furrow’d next the god design’d,[256]

Poem Title: THE GRIEF OF ACHILLES, AND NEW ARMOUR MADE HIM BY VULCAN.
line: The third time labour’d by the sweating hind;

Poem Title: THE GRIEF OF ACHILLES, AND NEW ARMOUR MADE HIM BY VULCAN.
line: The shining shares full many ploughmen guide,

Poem Title: THE GRIEF OF ACHILLES, AND NEW ARMOUR MADE HIM BY VULCAN.
line: And turn their crooked yokes on every side.

Poem Title: THE GRIEF OF ACHILLES, AND NEW ARMOUR MADE HIM BY VULCAN.
line: Still as at either end they wheel around,

Poem Title: THE GRIEF OF ACHILLES, AND NEW ARMOUR MADE HIM BY VULCAN.
line: The master meets them with his goblet crown’d;

Poem Title: THE GRIEF OF ACHILLES, AND NEW ARMOUR MADE HIM BY VULCAN.
line: The hearty draught rewards, renews their toil,

Poem Title: THE GRIEF OF ACHILLES, AND NEW ARMOUR MADE HIM BY VULCAN.
line: Then back the turning ploughshares cleave the soil:

Poem Title: THE GRIEF OF ACHILLES, AND NEW ARMOUR MADE HIM BY VULCAN.
line: Behind, the rising earth in ridges roll’d;

Poem Title: THE GRIEF OF ACHILLES, AND NEW ARMOUR MADE HIM BY VULCAN.
line: And sable look’d, though form’d of molten gold.

Poem Title: THE GRIEF OF ACHILLES, AND NEW ARMOUR MADE HIM BY VULCAN.
THE GRIEF OF ACHILLES, AND NEW ARMOUR MADE HIM BY VULCAN.
line: Another field rose high with waving grain;

Poem Title: THE GRIEF OF ACHILLES, AND NEW ARMOUR MADE HIM BY VULCAN.
line: With bended sickles stand the reaper train:

Poem Title: THE GRIEF OF ACHILLES, AND NEW ARMOUR MADE HIM BY VULCAN.
line: Here stretched in ranks the levell’d swarths are found,

Poem Title: THE GRIEF OF ACHILLES, AND NEW ARMOUR MADE HIM BY VULCAN.
line: Sheaves heap’d on sheaves here thicken up the ground.

Poem Title: THE GRIEF OF ACHILLES, AND NEW ARMOUR MADE HIM BY VULCAN.
line: With sweeping stroke the mowers strow the lands;

Poem Title: THE GRIEF OF ACHILLES, AND NEW ARMOUR MADE HIM BY VULCAN.
line: The gatherers follow, and collect in bands;

Poem Title: THE GRIEF OF ACHILLES, AND NEW ARMOUR MADE HIM BY VULCAN.
line: And last the children, in whose arms are borne

Poem Title: THE GRIEF OF ACHILLES, AND NEW ARMOUR MADE HIM BY VULCAN.
line: (Too short to gripe them) the brown sheaves of corn.

Poem Title: THE GRIEF OF ACHILLES, AND NEW ARMOUR MADE HIM BY VULCAN.
line: The rustic monarch of the field descries,

Poem Title: THE GRIEF OF ACHILLES, AND NEW ARMOUR MADE HIM BY VULCAN.
line: With silent glee, the heaps around him rise.

Poem Title: THE GRIEF OF ACHILLES, AND NEW ARMOUR MADE HIM BY VULCAN.
line: A ready banquet on the turf is laid,

Poem Title: THE GRIEF OF ACHILLES, AND NEW ARMOUR MADE HIM BY VULCAN.
line: Beneath an ample oak’s expanded shade.

Poem Title: THE GRIEF OF ACHILLES, AND NEW ARMOUR MADE HIM BY VULCAN.
line: The victim ox the sturdy youth prepare;

Poem Title: THE GRIEF OF ACHILLES, AND NEW ARMOUR MADE HIM BY VULCAN.
line: The reaper’s due repast, the woman’s care.

Poem Title: THE GRIEF OF ACHILLES, AND NEW ARMOUR MADE HIM BY VULCAN.
THE GRIEF OF ACHILLES, AND NEW ARMOUR MADE HIM BY VULCAN.
line: Next, ripe in yellow gold, a vineyard shines,

Poem Title: THE GRIEF OF ACHILLES, AND NEW ARMOUR MADE HIM BY VULCAN.
line: Bent with the ponderous harvest of its vines;

Poem Title: THE GRIEF OF ACHILLES, AND NEW ARMOUR MADE HIM BY VULCAN.
line: A deeper dye the dangling clusters show,

Poem Title: THE GRIEF OF ACHILLES, AND NEW ARMOUR MADE HIM BY VULCAN.
line: And curl’d on silver props, in order glow:

Poem Title: THE GRIEF OF ACHILLES, AND NEW ARMOUR MADE HIM BY VULCAN.
line: A darker metal mix’d intrench’d the place;

Poem Title: THE GRIEF OF ACHILLES, AND NEW ARMOUR MADE HIM BY VULCAN.
line: And pales of glittering tin the inclosure grace.

Poem Title: THE GRIEF OF ACHILLES, AND NEW ARMOUR MADE HIM BY VULCAN.
line: To this, one pathway gently winding leads,

Poem Title: THE GRIEF OF ACHILLES, AND NEW ARMOUR MADE HIM BY VULCAN.
line: Where march a train with baskets on their heads,

Poem Title: THE GRIEF OF ACHILLES, AND NEW ARMOUR MADE HIM BY VULCAN.
line: (Fair maids and blooming youths,) that smiling bear

Poem Title: THE GRIEF OF ACHILLES, AND NEW ARMOUR MADE HIM BY VULCAN.
line: The purple product of the autumnal year.

Poem Title: THE GRIEF OF ACHILLES, AND NEW ARMOUR MADE HIM BY VULCAN.
line: To these a youth awakes the warbling strings,

Poem Title: THE GRIEF OF ACHILLES, AND NEW ARMOUR MADE HIM BY VULCAN.
line: Whose tender lay the fate of Linus sings;

Poem Title: THE GRIEF OF ACHILLES, AND NEW ARMOUR MADE HIM BY VULCAN.
line: In measured dance behind him move the train,

Poem Title: THE GRIEF OF ACHILLES, AND NEW ARMOUR MADE HIM BY VULCAN.
line: Tune soft the voice, and answer to the strain.

Poem Title: THE GRIEF OF ACHILLES, AND NEW ARMOUR MADE HIM BY VULCAN.
THE GRIEF OF ACHILLES, AND NEW ARMOUR MADE HIM BY VULCAN.
line: Here herds of oxen march, erect and bold,

Poem Title: THE GRIEF OF ACHILLES, AND NEW ARMOUR MADE HIM BY VULCAN.
line: Rear high their horns, and seem to low in gold,

Poem Title: THE GRIEF OF ACHILLES, AND NEW ARMOUR MADE HIM BY VULCAN.
line: And speed to meadows on whose sounding shores

Poem Title: THE GRIEF OF ACHILLES, AND NEW ARMOUR MADE HIM BY VULCAN.
line: A rapid torrent through the rushes roars:

Poem Title: THE GRIEF OF ACHILLES, AND NEW ARMOUR MADE HIM BY VULCAN.
line: Four golden herdsmen as their guardians stand,

Poem Title: THE GRIEF OF ACHILLES, AND NEW ARMOUR MADE HIM BY VULCAN.
line: And nine sour dogs complete the rustic band.

Poem Title: THE GRIEF OF ACHILLES, AND NEW ARMOUR MADE HIM BY VULCAN.
line: Two lions rushing from the wood appear’d;

Poem Title: THE GRIEF OF ACHILLES, AND NEW ARMOUR MADE HIM BY VULCAN.
line: And seized a bull, the master of the herd:

Poem Title: THE GRIEF OF ACHILLES, AND NEW ARMOUR MADE HIM BY VULCAN.
line: He roar’d: in vain the dogs, the men withstood;

Poem Title: THE GRIEF OF ACHILLES, AND NEW ARMOUR MADE HIM BY VULCAN.
line: They tore his flesh, and drank his sable blood.

Poem Title: THE GRIEF OF ACHILLES, AND NEW ARMOUR MADE HIM BY VULCAN.
line: The dogs (oft cheer’d in vain) desert the prey,

Poem Title: THE GRIEF OF ACHILLES, AND NEW ARMOUR MADE HIM BY VULCAN.
line: Dread the grim terrors, and at distance bay.

Poem Title: THE GRIEF OF ACHILLES, AND NEW ARMOUR MADE HIM BY VULCAN.
THE GRIEF OF ACHILLES, AND NEW ARMOUR MADE HIM BY VULCAN.
line: Next this, the eye the art of Vulcan leads

Poem Title: THE GRIEF OF ACHILLES, AND NEW ARMOUR MADE HIM BY VULCAN.
line: Deep through fair forests, and a length of meads,

Poem Title: THE GRIEF OF ACHILLES, AND NEW ARMOUR MADE HIM BY VULCAN.
line: And stalls, and folds, and scatter’d cots between;

Poem Title: THE GRIEF OF ACHILLES, AND NEW ARMOUR MADE HIM BY VULCAN.
line: And fleecy flocks, that whiten all the scene.

Poem Title: THE GRIEF OF ACHILLES, AND NEW ARMOUR MADE HIM BY VULCAN.
THE GRIEF OF ACHILLES, AND NEW ARMOUR MADE HIM BY VULCAN.
line: A figured dance succeeds; such once was seen

Poem Title: THE GRIEF OF ACHILLES, AND NEW ARMOUR MADE HIM BY VULCAN.
line: In lofty Gnossus for the Cretan queen,

Poem Title: THE GRIEF OF ACHILLES, AND NEW ARMOUR MADE HIM BY VULCAN.
line: Form’d by Daedalean art; a comely band

Poem Title: THE GRIEF OF ACHILLES, AND NEW ARMOUR MADE HIM BY VULCAN.
line: Of youths and maidens, bounding hand in hand.

Poem Title: THE GRIEF OF ACHILLES, AND NEW ARMOUR MADE HIM BY VULCAN.
line: The maids in soft simars of linen dress’d;

Poem Title: THE GRIEF OF ACHILLES, AND NEW ARMOUR MADE HIM BY VULCAN.
line: The youths all graceful in the glossy vest:

Poem Title: THE GRIEF OF ACHILLES, AND NEW ARMOUR MADE HIM BY VULCAN.
line: Of those the locks with flowery wreath inroll’d;

Poem Title: THE GRIEF OF ACHILLES, AND NEW ARMOUR MADE HIM BY VULCAN.
line: Of these the sides adorn’d with swords of gold,

Poem Title: THE GRIEF OF ACHILLES, AND NEW ARMOUR MADE HIM BY VULCAN.
line: That glittering gay, from silver belts depend.

Poem Title: THE GRIEF OF ACHILLES, AND NEW ARMOUR MADE HIM BY VULCAN.
line: Now all at once they rise, at once descend,

Poem Title: THE GRIEF OF ACHILLES, AND NEW ARMOUR MADE HIM BY VULCAN.
line: With well-taught feet: now shape in oblique ways,

Poem Title: THE GRIEF OF ACHILLES, AND NEW ARMOUR MADE HIM BY VULCAN.
line: Confusedly regular, the moving maze:

Poem Title: THE GRIEF OF ACHILLES, AND NEW ARMOUR MADE HIM BY VULCAN.
line: Now forth at once, too swift for sight, they spring,

Poem Title: THE GRIEF OF ACHILLES, AND NEW ARMOUR MADE HIM BY VULCAN.
line: And undistinguish’d blend the flying ring:

Poem Title: THE GRIEF OF ACHILLES, AND NEW ARMOUR MADE HIM BY VULCAN.
line: So whirls a wheel, in giddy circle toss’d,

Poem Title: THE GRIEF OF ACHILLES, AND NEW ARMOUR MADE HIM BY VULCAN.
line: And, rapid as it runs, the single spokes are lost.

Poem Title: THE GRIEF OF ACHILLES, AND NEW ARMOUR MADE HIM BY VULCAN.
line: The gazing multitudes admire around:

Poem Title: THE GRIEF OF ACHILLES, AND NEW ARMOUR MADE HIM BY VULCAN.
line: Two active tumblers in the centre bound;

Poem Title: THE GRIEF OF ACHILLES, AND NEW ARMOUR MADE HIM BY VULCAN.
line: Now high, now low, their pliant limbs they bend:

Poem Title: THE GRIEF OF ACHILLES, AND NEW ARMOUR MADE HIM BY VULCAN.
line: And general songs the sprightly revel end.

Poem Title: THE GRIEF OF ACHILLES, AND NEW ARMOUR MADE HIM BY VULCAN.
THE GRIEF OF ACHILLES, AND NEW ARMOUR MADE HIM BY VULCAN.
line: Thus the broad shield complete the artist crown’d

Poem Title: THE GRIEF OF ACHILLES, AND NEW ARMOUR MADE HIM BY VULCAN.
line: With his last hand, and pour’d the ocean round:

Poem Title: THE GRIEF OF ACHILLES, AND NEW ARMOUR MADE HIM BY VULCAN.
line: In living silver seem’d the waves to roll,

Poem Title: THE GRIEF OF ACHILLES, AND NEW ARMOUR MADE HIM BY VULCAN.
line: And beat the buckler’s verge, and bound the whole.

Poem Title: THE GRIEF OF ACHILLES, AND NEW ARMOUR MADE HIM BY VULCAN.
THE GRIEF OF ACHILLES, AND NEW ARMOUR MADE HIM BY VULCAN.
line: This done, whate’er a warrior’s use requires

Poem Title: THE GRIEF OF ACHILLES, AND NEW ARMOUR MADE HIM BY VULCAN.
line: He forged; the cuirass that outshone the fires,

Poem Title: THE GRIEF OF ACHILLES, AND NEW ARMOUR MADE HIM BY VULCAN.
line: The greaves of ductile tin, the helm impress’d

line: With various sculpture, and the golden crest.

Poem Title: THE GRIEF OF ACHILLES, AND NEW ARMOUR MADE HIM BY VULCAN.
line: At Thetis’ feet the finished labour lay:

Poem Title: THE GRIEF OF ACHILLES, AND NEW ARMOUR MADE HIM BY VULCAN.
line: She, as a falcon cuts the aerial way,

Poem Title: THE GRIEF OF ACHILLES, AND NEW ARMOUR MADE HIM BY VULCAN.
line: Swift from Olympus’ snowy summit flies,

Poem Title: THE GRIEF OF ACHILLES, AND NEW ARMOUR MADE HIM BY VULCAN.
line: And bears the blazing present through the skies.[257]

Poem Title: THE RECONCILIATION OF ACHILLES AND AGAMEMNON.

Poem Title: THE RECONCILIATION OF ACHILLES AND AGAMEMNON.

Poem Title: THE RECONCILIATION OF ACHILLES AND AGAMEMNON.

Poem Title: THE RECONCILIATION OF ACHILLES AND AGAMEMNON.
line: arms for the fight: his appearance described. He addresses himself to

Poem Title: THE RECONCILIATION OF ACHILLES AND AGAMEMNON.

Poem Title: THE RECONCILIATION OF ACHILLES AND AGAMEMNON.

Poem Title: THE RECONCILIATION OF ACHILLES AND AGAMEMNON.
line: the combat.

Poem Title: THE RECONCILIATION OF ACHILLES AND AGAMEMNON.

line: Soon as Aurora heaved her Orient head

Poem Title: THE RECONCILIATION OF ACHILLES AND AGAMEMNON.
line: Above the waves, that blush’d with early red,

line: (With new-born day to gladden mortal sight,

Poem Title: THE RECONCILIATION OF ACHILLES AND AGAMEMNON.

Poem Title: THE RECONCILIATION OF ACHILLES AND AGAMEMNON.
line: The immortal arms the goddess-mother bears

line: Swift to her son: her son she finds in tears

line: Stretch’d o’er Patroclus’ corse; while all the rest

line: “Suppress, my son, this rage of grief, and know

line: Then drops the radiant burden on the ground;

line: Clang the strong arms, and ring the shores around;

Poem Title: THE RECONCILIATION OF ACHILLES AND AGAMEMNON.

line: “Goddess! (he cried,) these glorious arms, that shine

Poem Title: THE RECONCILIATION OF ACHILLES AND AGAMEMNON.

Poem Title: THE RECONCILIATION OF ACHILLES AND AGAMEMNON.

line: But least, the sons of Priam’s hateful race.

Poem Title: THE BATTLE IN THE RIVER SCAMANDER.[269]
line: Die then, my friend! what boots it to deplore?

Poem Title: THE BATTLE IN THE RIVER SCAMANDER.[269]
line: The great, the good Patroclus is no more!

Poem Title: THE BATTLE IN THE RIVER SCAMANDER.[269]
line: He, far thy better, was foredoom’d to die,

Poem Title: THE BATTLE IN THE RIVER SCAMANDER.[269]
line: And thou, dost thou bewail mortality?

Poem Title: THE BATTLE IN THE RIVER SCAMANDER.[269]
line: Seest thou not me, whom nature’s gifts adorn,

Poem Title: THE BATTLE IN THE RIVER SCAMANDER.[269]
line: Sprung from a hero, from a goddess born?

Poem Title: THE BATTLE IN THE RIVER SCAMANDER.[269]
line: The day shall come (which nothing can avert)

Poem Title: THE BATTLE IN THE RIVER SCAMANDER.[269]
line: When by the spear, the arrow, or the dart,

Poem Title: THE BATTLE IN THE RIVER SCAMANDER.[269]
line: By night, or day, by force, or by design,

Poem Title: THE BATTLE IN THE RIVER SCAMANDER.[269]
line: Impending death and certain fate are mine!

Poem Title: THE BATTLE IN THE RIVER SCAMANDER.[269]
line: Die then,”—He said; and as the word he spoke,

Poem Title: THE BATTLE IN THE RIVER SCAMANDER.[269]
line: The fainting stripling sank before the stroke:

Poem Title: THE BATTLE IN THE RIVER SCAMANDER.[269]
line: His hand forgot its grasp, and left the spear,

Poem Title: THE BATTLE IN THE RIVER SCAMANDER.[269]
line: While all his trembling frame confess’d his fear:

Poem Title: THE BATTLE IN THE RIVER SCAMANDER.[269]
line: Sudden, Achilles his broad sword display’d,

Poem Title: THE BATTLE IN THE RIVER SCAMANDER.[269]
line: And buried in his neck the reeking blade.

Poem Title: THE BATTLE IN THE RIVER SCAMANDER.[269]
line: Prone fell the youth; and panting on the land,

Poem Title: THE BATTLE IN THE RIVER SCAMANDER.[269]
line: The gushing purple dyed the thirsty sand.

Poem Title: THE BATTLE IN THE RIVER SCAMANDER.[269]
line: The victor to the stream the carcase gave,

Poem Title: THE BATTLE IN THE RIVER SCAMANDER.[269]
line: And thus insults him, floating on the wave:

Poem Title: THE BATTLE IN THE RIVER SCAMANDER.[269]
THE BATTLE IN THE RIVER SCAMANDER.[269]
line: “Lie there, Lycaon! let the fish surround

Poem Title: THE BATTLE IN THE RIVER SCAMANDER.[269]
line: Thy bloated corpse, and suck thy gory wound:

Poem Title: THE BATTLE IN THE RIVER SCAMANDER.[269]
line: There no sad mother shall thy funerals weep,

Poem Title: THE BATTLE IN THE RIVER SCAMANDER.[269]
line: But swift Scamander roll thee to the deep,

Poem Title: THE BATTLE IN THE RIVER SCAMANDER.[269]
line: Whose every wave some watery monster brings,

Poem Title: THE BATTLE IN THE RIVER SCAMANDER.[269]
line: To feast unpunish’d on the fat of kings.

Poem Title: THE BATTLE IN THE RIVER SCAMANDER.[269]
line: So perish Troy, and all the Trojan line!

Poem Title: THE BATTLE IN THE RIVER SCAMANDER.[269]
line: Such ruin theirs, and such compassion mine.

Poem Title: THE BATTLE IN THE RIVER SCAMANDER.[269]
line: What boots ye now Scamander’s worshipp’d stream,

Poem Title: THE BATTLE IN THE RIVER SCAMANDER.[269]
line: His earthly honours, and immortal name?

Poem Title: THE BATTLE IN THE RIVER SCAMANDER.[269]
line: In vain your immolated bulls are slain,

Poem Title: THE BATTLE IN THE RIVER SCAMANDER.[269]
line: Your living coursers glut his gulfs in vain!

Poem Title: THE BATTLE IN THE RIVER SCAMANDER.[269]
line: Thus he rewards you, with this bitter fate;

Poem Title: THE BATTLE IN THE RIVER SCAMANDER.[269]
line: Thus, till the Grecian vengeance is complete:

Poem Title: THE BATTLE IN THE RIVER SCAMANDER.[269]
line: Thus is atoned Patroclus’ honour’d shade,

Poem Title: THE BATTLE IN THE RIVER SCAMANDER.[269]
line: And the short absence of Achilles paid.”

Poem Title: THE BATTLE IN THE RIVER SCAMANDER.[269]
THE BATTLE IN THE RIVER SCAMANDER.[269]
line: These boastful words provoked the raging god;

Poem Title: THE BATTLE IN THE RIVER SCAMANDER.[269]
line: With fury swells the violated flood.

Poem Title: THE BATTLE IN THE RIVER SCAMANDER.[269]
line: What means divine may yet the power employ

Poem Title: THE BATTLE IN THE RIVER SCAMANDER.[269]
line: To check Achilles, and to rescue Troy?

Poem Title: THE BATTLE IN THE RIVER SCAMANDER.[269]
line: Meanwhile the hero springs in arms, to dare

Poem Title: THE BATTLE IN THE RIVER SCAMANDER.[269]
line: The great Asteropeus to mortal war;

Poem Title: THE BATTLE IN THE RIVER SCAMANDER.[269]
line: The son of Pelagon, whose lofty line

Poem Title: THE BATTLE IN THE RIVER SCAMANDER.[269]
line: Flows from the source of Axius, stream divine!

Poem Title: THE BATTLE IN THE RIVER SCAMANDER.[269]
line: (Fair Peribaea’s love the god had crown’d,

Poem Title: THE BATTLE IN THE RIVER SCAMANDER.[269]
line: With all his refluent waters circled round:)

Poem Title: THE BATTLE IN THE RIVER SCAMANDER.[269]
line: On him Achilles rush’d; he fearless stood,

Poem Title: THE BATTLE IN THE RIVER SCAMANDER.[269]
line: And shook two spears, advancing from the flood;

Poem Title: THE BATTLE IN THE RIVER SCAMANDER.[269]
line: The flood impell’d him, on Pelides’ head

Poem Title: THE BATTLE IN THE RIVER SCAMANDER.[269]
line: To avenge his waters choked with heaps of dead.

Poem Title: THE BATTLE IN THE RIVER SCAMANDER.[269]
line: Near as they drew, Achilles thus began:

Poem Title: THE BATTLE IN THE RIVER SCAMANDER.[269]
THE BATTLE IN THE RIVER SCAMANDER.[269]
line: “What art thou, boldest of the race of man?

Poem Title: THE BATTLE IN THE RIVER SCAMANDER.[269]
line: Who, or from whence? Unhappy is the sire

Poem Title: THE BATTLE IN THE RIVER SCAMANDER.[269]
line: Whose son encounters our resistless ire.”

Poem Title: THE BATTLE IN THE RIVER SCAMANDER.[269]
THE BATTLE IN THE RIVER SCAMANDER.[269]
line: “O son of Peleus! what avails to trace

Poem Title: THE BATTLE IN THE RIVER SCAMANDER.[269]
line: (Replied the warrior) our illustrious race?

Poem Title: THE BATTLE IN THE RIVER SCAMANDER.[269]
line: From rich Paeonia’s valleys I command,

Poem Title: THE BATTLE IN THE RIVER SCAMANDER.[269]
line: Arm’d with protended spears, my native band;

Poem Title: THE BATTLE IN THE RIVER SCAMANDER.[269]
line: Now shines the tenth bright morning since I came

Poem Title: THE BATTLE IN THE RIVER SCAMANDER.[269]
line: In aid of Ilion to the fields of fame:

Poem Title: THE BATTLE IN THE RIVER SCAMANDER.[269]
line: Axius, who swells with all the neighbouring rills,

Poem Title: THE BATTLE IN THE RIVER SCAMANDER.[269]
line: And wide around the floated region fills,

Poem Title: THE BATTLE IN THE RIVER SCAMANDER.[269]
line: Begot my sire, whose spear much glory won:

Poem Title: THE BATTLE IN THE RIVER SCAMANDER.[269]
line: Now lift thy arm, and try that hero’s son!”

Poem Title: THE BATTLE IN THE RIVER SCAMANDER.[269]
THE BATTLE IN THE RIVER SCAMANDER.[269]
line: Threatening he said: the hostile chiefs advance;

Poem Title: THE BATTLE IN THE RIVER SCAMANDER.[269]
line: At once Asteropeus discharged each lance,

Poem Title: THE BATTLE IN THE RIVER SCAMANDER.[269]
line: (For both his dexterous hands the lance could wield,)

Poem Title: THE BATTLE IN THE RIVER SCAMANDER.[269]
line: One struck, but pierced not, the Vulcanian shield;

Poem Title: THE BATTLE IN THE RIVER SCAMANDER.[269]
line: One razed Achilles’ hand; the spouting blood

Poem Title: THE BATTLE IN THE RIVER SCAMANDER.[269]
line: Spun forth; in earth the fasten’d weapon stood.

Poem Title: THE BATTLE IN THE RIVER SCAMANDER.[269]
line: Like lightning next the Pelean javelin flies:

Poem Title: THE BATTLE IN THE RIVER SCAMANDER.[269]
line: Its erring fury hiss’d along the skies;

Poem Title: THE BATTLE IN THE RIVER SCAMANDER.[269]
line: Deep in the swelling bank was driven the spear,

Poem Title: THE BATTLE IN THE RIVER SCAMANDER.[269]
line: Even to the middle earth; and quiver’d there.

Poem Title: THE BATTLE IN THE RIVER SCAMANDER.[269]
line: Then from his side the sword Pelides drew,

Poem Title: THE BATTLE IN THE RIVER SCAMANDER.[269]
line: And on his foe with double fury flew.

Poem Title: THE BATTLE IN THE RIVER SCAMANDER.[269]
line: The foe thrice tugg’d, and shook the rooted wood;

Poem Title: THE BATTLE IN THE RIVER SCAMANDER.[269]
line: Repulsive of his might the weapon stood:

Poem Title: THE BATTLE IN THE RIVER SCAMANDER.[269]
line: The fourth, he tries to break the spear in vain;

Poem Title: THE BATTLE IN THE RIVER SCAMANDER.[269]
line: Bent as he stands, he tumbles to the plain;

Poem Title: THE BATTLE IN THE RIVER SCAMANDER.[269]
line: His belly open’d with a ghastly wound,

Poem Title: THE BATTLE IN THE RIVER SCAMANDER.[269]
line: The reeking entrails pour upon the ground.

Poem Title: THE BATTLE IN THE RIVER SCAMANDER.[269]
line: Beneath the hero’s feet he panting lies,

line: And his eye darkens, and his spirit flies;

Poem Title: THE BATTLE IN THE RIVER SCAMANDER.[269]
line: While the proud victor thus triumphing said,

line: His radiant armour tearing from the dead:

THE BATTLE IN THE RIVER SCAMANDER.[269]
line: “So ends thy glory! Such the fate they prove,

Poem Title: THE BATTLE IN THE RIVER SCAMANDER.[269]
line: Who strive presumptuous with the sons of Jove!

Poem Title: THE BATTLE IN THE RIVER SCAMANDER.[269]
line: Sprung from a river, didst thou boast thy line?

Poem Title: THE BATTLE IN THE RIVER SCAMANDER.[269]
line: But great Saturnius is the source of mine.

Poem Title: THE BATTLE IN THE RIVER SCAMANDER.[269]
line: How durst thou vaunt thy watery progeny?

Poem Title: THE BATTLE IN THE RIVER SCAMANDER.[269]
line: Of Peleus, Æacus, and Jove, am I.

Poem Title: THE BATTLE IN THE RIVER SCAMANDER.[269]
line: The race of these superior far to those,

Poem Title: THE BATTLE IN THE RIVER SCAMANDER.[269]
line: As he that thunders to the stream that flows.

Poem Title: THE BATTLE IN THE RIVER SCAMANDER.[269]
line: What rivers can, Scamander might have shown;

Poem Title: THE BATTLE IN THE RIVER SCAMANDER.[269]
line: But Jove he dreads, nor wars against his son.

Poem Title: THE BATTLE IN THE RIVER SCAMANDER.[269]
line: Even Achelous might contend in vain,

Poem Title: THE BATTLE IN THE RIVER SCAMANDER.[269]
line: And all the roaring billows of the main.

Poem Title: THE BATTLE IN THE RIVER SCAMANDER.[269]
line: The eternal ocean, from whose fountains flow

Poem Title: THE BATTLE IN THE RIVER SCAMANDER.[269]

Poem Title: THE BATTLE IN THE RIVER SCAMANDER.[269]
line: The thundering voice of Jove abhors to hear,

Poem Title: THE BATTLE IN THE RIVER SCAMANDER.[269]
line: And in his deep abysses shakes with fear.”

Poem Title: THE BATTLE IN THE RIVER SCAMANDER.[269]
THE BATTLE IN THE RIVER SCAMANDER.[269]
line: He said: then from the bank his javelin tore,

Poem Title: THE BATTLE IN THE RIVER SCAMANDER.[269]
line: And left the breathless warrior in his gore.

Poem Title: THE BATTLE IN THE RIVER SCAMANDER.[269]
line: The floating tides the bloody carcase lave,

Poem Title: THE BATTLE IN THE RIVER SCAMANDER.[269]
line: And beat against it, wave succeeding wave;

line: Till, roll’d between the banks, it lies the food

Poem Title: THE BATTLE IN THE RIVER SCAMANDER.[269]
line: Of curling eels, and fishes of the flood.

line: All scatter’d round the stream (their mightiest slain)

line: The amazed Pæonians scour along the plain;

line: He vents his fury on the flying crew,

line: And numbers more his lance had plunged to hell,

line: But from the bottom of his gulfs profound

Poem Title: THE BATTLE IN THE RIVER SCAMANDER.[269]
line: Scamander spoke; the shores return’d the sound.

Poem Title: THE BATTLE IN THE RIVER SCAMANDER.[269]
THE BATTLE IN THE RIVER SCAMANDER.[269]
line: “O first of mortals! (for the gods are thine)

Poem Title: THE BATTLE IN THE RIVER SCAMANDER.[269]
line: In valour matchless, and in force divine!

line: If Jove have given thee every Trojan head,

line: ’Tis not on me thy rage should heap the dead.

line: See! my choked streams no more their course can keep,

line: Nor roll their wonted tribute to the deep.

line: Turn then, impetuous! from our injured flood;

line: Content, thy slaughters could amaze a god.”

Poem Title: THE BATTLE IN THE RIVER SCAMANDER.[269]
THE BATTLE IN THE RIVER SCAMANDER.[269]
line: In human form, confess’d before his eyes,

Poem Title: THE BATTLE IN THE RIVER SCAMANDER.[269]
line: The river thus; and thus the chief replies:

line: “O sacred stream! thy word we shall obey;

Poem Title: THE BATTLE IN THE RIVER SCAMANDER.[269]
line: But not till Troy the destined vengeance pay,

Poem Title: THE BATTLE IN THE RIVER SCAMANDER.[269]
line: Not till within her towers the perjured train

Poem Title: THE BATTLE IN THE RIVER SCAMANDER.[269]
line: Shall pant, and tremble at our arms again;

Poem Title: THE BATTLE IN THE RIVER SCAMANDER.[269]
line: Not till proud Hector, guardian of her wall,

Poem Title: THE BATTLE IN THE RIVER SCAMANDER.[269]
line: Or stain this lance, or see Achilles fall.”

Poem Title: THE BATTLE IN THE RIVER SCAMANDER.[269]
THE BATTLE IN THE RIVER SCAMANDER.[269]
line: He said; and drove with fury on the foe.

Poem Title: THE BATTLE IN THE RIVER SCAMANDER.[269]
line: Then to the godhead of the silver bow

Poem Title: THE BATTLE IN THE RIVER SCAMANDER.[269]
line: The yellow flood began: “O son of Jove!

Poem Title: THE BATTLE IN THE RIVER SCAMANDER.[269]
line: Was not the mandate of the sire above

line: And make her conquer, till Hyperion’s fall

line: In awful darkness hide the face of all?”

Poem Title: THE BATTLE IN THE RIVER SCAMANDER.[269]
THE BATTLE IN THE RIVER SCAMANDER.[269]
line: He spoke in vain—The chief without dismay

Poem Title: THE BATTLE IN THE RIVER SCAMANDER.[269]
line: Ploughs through the boiling surge his desperate way.

Poem Title: THE BATTLE IN THE RIVER SCAMANDER.[269]
line: Then rising in his rage above the shores,

line: From all his deep the bellowing river roars,

line: Huge heaps of slain disgorges on the coast,

line: And round the banks the ghastly dead are toss’d.

Poem Title: THE BATTLE IN THE RIVER SCAMANDER.[269]
line: While all before, the billows ranged on high,

line: (A watery bulwark,) screen the bands who fly.

Poem Title: THE BATTLE IN THE RIVER SCAMANDER.[269]
line: Now bursting on his head with thundering sound,

line: The falling deluge whelms the hero round:

line: His loaded shield bends to the rushing tide;

line: His feet, upborne, scarce the strong flood divide,

Poem Title: THE BATTLE IN THE RIVER SCAMANDER.[269]
line: Sliddering, and staggering. On the border stood

Poem Title: THE BATTLE IN THE RIVER SCAMANDER.[269]
line: A spreading elm, that overhung the flood;

line: He seized a bending bough, his steps to stay;

line: The plant uprooted to his weight gave way.[270]

Poem Title: THE BATTLE IN THE RIVER SCAMANDER.[269]
line: Heaving the bank, and undermining all;

Poem Title: THE BATTLE IN THE RIVER SCAMANDER.[269]
line: Loud flash the waters to the rushing fall

Poem Title: THE BATTLE IN THE RIVER SCAMANDER.[269]
line: Of the thick foliage. The large trunk display’d

Poem Title: THE BATTLE IN THE RIVER SCAMANDER.[269]
line: Bridged the rough flood across: the hero stay’d

Poem Title: THE BATTLE IN THE RIVER SCAMANDER.[269]
line: On this his weight, and raised upon his hand,

Poem Title: THE BATTLE IN THE RIVER SCAMANDER.[269]
line: Leap’d from the channel, and regain’d the land.

Poem Title: THE BATTLE IN THE RIVER SCAMANDER.[269]
line: Then blacken’d the wild waves: the murmur rose:

line: The god pursues, a huger billow throws,

line: And bursts the bank, ambitious to destroy

Poem Title: THE BATTLE IN THE RIVER SCAMANDER.[269]
line: The man whose fury is the fate of Troy.

Poem Title: THE BATTLE IN THE RIVER SCAMANDER.[269]
line: He like the warlike eagle speeds his pace

Poem Title: THE BATTLE IN THE RIVER SCAMANDER.[269]
line: (Swiftest and strongest of the aerial race);

Poem Title: THE BATTLE IN THE RIVER SCAMANDER.[269]
line: Far as a spear can fly, Achilles springs;

Poem Title: THE BATTLE IN THE RIVER SCAMANDER.[269]
line: At every bound his clanging armour rings:

Poem Title: THE BATTLE IN THE RIVER SCAMANDER.[269]
line: Now here, now there, he turns on every side,

Poem Title: THE BATTLE IN THE RIVER SCAMANDER.[269]
line: And winds his course before the following tide;

Poem Title: THE BATTLE IN THE RIVER SCAMANDER.[269]
line: The waves flow after, wheresoe’er he wheels,

Poem Title: THE BATTLE IN THE RIVER SCAMANDER.[269]
line: And gather fast, and murmur at his heels.

Poem Title: THE BATTLE IN THE RIVER SCAMANDER.[269]
line: So when a peasant to his garden brings

Poem Title: THE BATTLE IN THE RIVER SCAMANDER.[269]
line: Soft rills of water from the bubbling springs,

line: And calls the floods from high, to bless his bowers,

line: And feed with pregnant streams the plants and flowers:

line: Soon as he clears whate’er their passage stay’d,

Poem Title: THE BATTLE IN THE RIVER SCAMANDER.[269]
line: And marks the future current with his spade,

Poem Title: THE BATTLE IN THE RIVER SCAMANDER.[269]
line: Swift o’er the rolling pebbles, down the hills,

Poem Title: THE BATTLE IN THE RIVER SCAMANDER.[269]
line: Louder and louder purl the falling rills;

Poem Title: THE BATTLE IN THE RIVER SCAMANDER.[269]
line: Before him scattering, they prevent his pains,

Poem Title: THE BATTLE IN THE RIVER SCAMANDER.[269]
line: And shine in mazy wanderings o’er the plains.

Poem Title: THE BATTLE IN THE RIVER SCAMANDER.[269]
THE BATTLE IN THE RIVER SCAMANDER.[269]
line: Still flies Achilles, but before his eyes

Poem Title: THE BATTLE IN THE RIVER SCAMANDER.[269]
line: Still swift Scamander rolls where’er he flies:

Poem Title: THE BATTLE IN THE RIVER SCAMANDER.[269]
line: Not all his speed escapes the rapid floods;

Poem Title: THE BATTLE IN THE RIVER SCAMANDER.[269]
line: The first of men, but not a match for gods.

Poem Title: THE BATTLE IN THE RIVER SCAMANDER.[269]
line: Oft as he turn’d the torrent to oppose,

Poem Title: THE BATTLE IN THE RIVER SCAMANDER.[269]
line: And bravely try if all the powers were foes;

line: So oft the surge, in watery mountains spread,

line: Beats on his back, or bursts upon his head.

Poem Title: THE BATTLE IN THE RIVER SCAMANDER.[269]
line: Yet dauntless still the adverse flood he braves,

Poem Title: THE BATTLE IN THE RIVER SCAMANDER.[269]
line: And still indignant bounds above the waves.

line: Tired by the tides, his knees relax with toil;

Poem Title: THE BATTLE IN THE RIVER SCAMANDER.[269]
line: Wash’d from beneath him slides the slimy soil;

Poem Title: THE BATTLE IN THE RIVER SCAMANDER.[269]
line: When thus (his eyes on heaven’s expansion thrown)

Poem Title: THE BATTLE IN THE RIVER SCAMANDER.[269]
line: Forth bursts the hero with an angry groan:

Poem Title: THE BATTLE IN THE RIVER SCAMANDER.[269]
THE BATTLE IN THE RIVER SCAMANDER.[269]
line: “Is there no god Achilles to befriend,

Poem Title: THE BATTLE IN THE RIVER SCAMANDER.[269]
line: No power to avert his miserable end?

Poem Title: THE BATTLE IN THE RIVER SCAMANDER.[269]
line: Prevent, O Jove! this ignominious date,[271]

Poem Title: THE BATTLE IN THE RIVER SCAMANDER.[269]
line: And make my future life the sport of fate.

Poem Title: THE BATTLE IN THE RIVER SCAMANDER.[269]
line: Of all heaven’s oracles believed in vain,

Poem Title: THE BATTLE IN THE RIVER SCAMANDER.[269]
line: But most of Thetis must her son complain;

Poem Title: THE BATTLE IN THE RIVER SCAMANDER.[269]
line: By Phœbus’ darts she prophesied my fall,

Poem Title: THE BATTLE IN THE RIVER SCAMANDER.[269]
line: In glorious arms before the Trojan wall.

Poem Title: THE BATTLE IN THE RIVER SCAMANDER.[269]
line: Oh! had I died in fields of battle warm,

Poem Title: THE BATTLE IN THE RIVER SCAMANDER.[269]
line: Stretch’d like a hero, by a hero’s arm!

Poem Title: THE BATTLE IN THE RIVER SCAMANDER.[269]
line: Might Hector’s spear this dauntless bosom rend,

line: And my swift soul o’ertake my slaughter’d friend.

Poem Title: THE BATTLE IN THE RIVER SCAMANDER.[269]
line: Ah no! Achilles meets a shameful fate,

Poem Title: THE BATTLE IN THE RIVER SCAMANDER.[269]

line: Like some vile swain, whom on a rainy day,

line: Crossing a ford, the torrent sweeps away,

line: An unregarded carcase to the sea.”

Poem Title: THE BATTLE IN THE RIVER SCAMANDER.[269]
THE BATTLE IN THE RIVER SCAMANDER.[269]
line: Neptune and Pallas haste to his relief,

Poem Title: THE BATTLE IN THE RIVER SCAMANDER.[269]
line: And thus in human form address’d the chief:

Poem Title: THE BATTLE IN THE RIVER SCAMANDER.[269]
line: The power of ocean first: “Forbear thy fear,

Poem Title: THE BATTLE IN THE RIVER SCAMANDER.[269]
line: O son of Peleus! Lo, thy gods appear!

line: Behold! from Jove descending to thy aid,

Poem Title: THE BATTLE IN THE RIVER SCAMANDER.[269]
line: Propitious Neptune, and the blue-eyed maid.

Poem Title: THE BATTLE IN THE RIVER SCAMANDER.[269]
line: Stay, and the furious flood shall cease to rave

Poem Title: THE BATTLE IN THE RIVER SCAMANDER.[269]
line: ’Tis not thy fate to glut his angry wave.

Poem Title: THE BATTLE IN THE RIVER SCAMANDER.[269]
line: But thou, the counsel heaven suggests, attend!

Poem Title: THE BATTLE IN THE RIVER SCAMANDER.[269]
line: Nor breathe from combat, nor thy sword suspend,

Poem Title: THE BATTLE IN THE RIVER SCAMANDER.[269]
line: Till Troy receive her flying sons, till all

Poem Title: THE BATTLE IN THE RIVER SCAMANDER.[269]
line: Her routed squadrons pant behind their wall:

Poem Title: THE BATTLE IN THE RIVER SCAMANDER.[269]
line: Hector alone shall stand his fatal chance,

Poem Title: THE BATTLE IN THE RIVER SCAMANDER.[269]
line: And Hector’s blood shall smoke upon thy lance.

Poem Title: THE BATTLE IN THE RIVER SCAMANDER.[269]
line: Thine is the glory doom’d.” Thus spake the gods:

Poem Title: THE BATTLE IN THE RIVER SCAMANDER.[269]
line: Then swift ascended to the bright abodes.

Poem Title: THE BATTLE IN THE RIVER SCAMANDER.[269]
THE BATTLE IN THE RIVER SCAMANDER.[269]
line: Stung with new ardour, thus by heaven impell’d,

Poem Title: THE BATTLE IN THE RIVER SCAMANDER.[269]
line: He springs impetuous, and invades the field:

Poem Title: THE BATTLE IN THE RIVER SCAMANDER.[269]
line: O’er all the expanded plain the waters spread;

Poem Title: THE BATTLE IN THE RIVER SCAMANDER.[269]
line: Heaved on the bounding billows danced the dead,

Poem Title: THE BATTLE IN THE RIVER SCAMANDER.[269]
line: Floating ’midst scatter’d arms; while casques of gold

Poem Title: THE BATTLE IN THE RIVER SCAMANDER.[269]
line: And turn’d-up bucklers glitter’d as they roll’d.

Poem Title: THE BATTLE IN THE RIVER SCAMANDER.[269]
line: High o’er the surging tide, by leaps and bounds,

Poem Title: THE BATTLE IN THE RIVER SCAMANDER.[269]
line: He wades, and mounts; the parted wave resounds.

Poem Title: THE BATTLE IN THE RIVER SCAMANDER.[269]
line: Not a whole river stops the hero’s course,

Poem Title: THE BATTLE IN THE RIVER SCAMANDER.[269]
line: While Pallas fills him with immortal force.

Poem Title: THE BATTLE IN THE RIVER SCAMANDER.[269]
line: With equal rage, indignant Xanthus roars,

Poem Title: THE BATTLE IN THE RIVER SCAMANDER.[269]
line: And lifts his billows, and o’erwhelms his shores.

Poem Title: THE BATTLE IN THE RIVER SCAMANDER.[269]
THE BATTLE IN THE RIVER SCAMANDER.[269]
line: Then thus to Simois! “Haste, my brother flood;

Poem Title: THE BATTLE IN THE RIVER SCAMANDER.[269]
line: And check this mortal that controls a god;

Poem Title: THE BATTLE IN THE RIVER SCAMANDER.[269]
line: Our bravest heroes else shall quit the fight,

Poem Title: THE BATTLE IN THE RIVER SCAMANDER.[269]
line: And Ilion tumble from her towery height.

Poem Title: THE BATTLE IN THE RIVER SCAMANDER.[269]
line: Call then thy subject streams, and bid them roar,

Poem Title: THE BATTLE IN THE RIVER SCAMANDER.[269]
line: From all thy fountains swell thy watery store,

Poem Title: THE BATTLE IN THE RIVER SCAMANDER.[269]
line: With broken rocks, and with a load of dead,

Poem Title: THE BATTLE IN THE RIVER SCAMANDER.[269]
line: Charge the black surge, and pour it on his head.

Poem Title: THE BATTLE IN THE RIVER SCAMANDER.[269]
line: Mark how resistless through the floods he goes,

Poem Title: THE BATTLE IN THE RIVER SCAMANDER.[269]
line: And boldly bids the warring gods be foes!

Poem Title: THE BATTLE IN THE RIVER SCAMANDER.[269]
line: But nor that force, nor form divine to sight,

Poem Title: THE BATTLE IN THE RIVER SCAMANDER.[269]
line: Shall aught avail him, if our rage unite:

Poem Title: THE BATTLE IN THE RIVER SCAMANDER.[269]
line: Whelm’d under our dark gulfs those arms shall lie,

Poem Title: THE BATTLE IN THE RIVER SCAMANDER.[269]
line: That blaze so dreadful in each Trojan eye;

Poem Title: THE BATTLE IN THE RIVER SCAMANDER.[269]
line: And deep beneath a sandy mountain hurl’d,

Poem Title: THE BATTLE IN THE RIVER SCAMANDER.[269]
line: Immersed remain this terror of the world.

Poem Title: THE BATTLE IN THE RIVER SCAMANDER.[269]
line: Such ponderous ruin shall confound the place,

Poem Title: THE BATTLE IN THE RIVER SCAMANDER.[269]
line: No Greeks shall e’er his perish’d relics grace,

Poem Title: THE BATTLE IN THE RIVER SCAMANDER.[269]
line: No hand his bones shall gather, or inhume;

Poem Title: THE BATTLE IN THE RIVER SCAMANDER.[269]
line: These his cold rites, and this his watery tomb.”

line: He said; and on the chief descends amain,

line: Increased with gore, and swelling with the slain.

line: Then, murmuring from his beds, he boils, he raves,

line: And a foam whitens on the purple waves:

line: At every step, before Achilles stood

Poem Title: THE BATTLE IN THE RIVER SCAMANDER.[269]
line: The crimson surge, and deluged him with blood.

Poem Title: THE BATTLE IN THE RIVER SCAMANDER.[269]
line: Fear touch’d the queen of heaven: she saw dismay’d,

line: She call’d aloud, and summon’d Vulcan’s aid.

Poem Title: THE BATTLE IN THE RIVER SCAMANDER.[269]
THE BATTLE IN THE RIVER SCAMANDER.[269]
line: “Rise to the war! the insulting flood requires

Poem Title: THE BATTLE IN THE RIVER SCAMANDER.[269]
line: Thy wasteful arm! assemble all thy fires!

Poem Title: THE BATTLE IN THE RIVER SCAMANDER.[269]
line: While to their aid, by our command enjoin’d,

Poem Title: THE BATTLE IN THE RIVER SCAMANDER.[269]
line: Rush the swift eastern and the western wind:

Poem Title: THE BATTLE IN THE RIVER SCAMANDER.[269]
line: These from old ocean at my word shall blow,

Poem Title: THE BATTLE IN THE RIVER SCAMANDER.[269]
line: Pour the red torrent on the watery foe,

Poem Title: THE BATTLE IN THE RIVER SCAMANDER.[269]
line: Corses and arms to one bright ruin turn,

Poem Title: THE BATTLE IN THE RIVER SCAMANDER.[269]
line: And hissing rivers to their bottoms burn.

Poem Title: THE BATTLE IN THE RIVER SCAMANDER.[269]
line: Go, mighty in thy rage! display thy power,

Poem Title: THE BATTLE IN THE RIVER SCAMANDER.[269]
line: Drink the whole flood, the crackling trees devour.

Poem Title: THE BATTLE IN THE RIVER SCAMANDER.[269]
line: Scorch all the banks! and (till our voice reclaim)

line: Exert the unwearied furies of the flame!”

Poem Title: THE BATTLE IN THE RIVER SCAMANDER.[269]
THE BATTLE IN THE RIVER SCAMANDER.[269]
line: The power ignipotent her word obeys:

Poem Title: THE BATTLE IN THE RIVER SCAMANDER.[269]
line: Wide o’er the plain he pours the boundless blaze;

Poem Title: THE BATTLE IN THE RIVER SCAMANDER.[269]
line: At once consumes the dead, and dries the soil

Poem Title: THE BATTLE IN THE RIVER SCAMANDER.[269]
line: And the shrunk waters in their channel boil.

Poem Title: THE BATTLE IN THE RIVER SCAMANDER.[269]
line: As when autumnal Boreas sweeps the sky,

Poem Title: THE BATTLE IN THE RIVER SCAMANDER.[269]
line: And instant blows the water’d gardens dry:

Poem Title: THE BATTLE IN THE RIVER SCAMANDER.[269]
line: So look’d the field, so whiten’d was the ground,

Poem Title: THE BATTLE IN THE RIVER SCAMANDER.[269]
line: While Vulcan breathed the fiery blast around.

Poem Title: THE BATTLE IN THE RIVER SCAMANDER.[269]
line: Swift on the sedgy reeds the ruin preys;

Poem Title: THE BATTLE IN THE RIVER SCAMANDER.[269]
line: Along the margin winds the running blaze:

Poem Title: THE BATTLE IN THE RIVER SCAMANDER.[269]
line: The trees in flaming rows to ashes turn,

Poem Title: THE BATTLE IN THE RIVER SCAMANDER.[269]
line: The flowering lotos and the tamarisk burn,

Poem Title: THE BATTLE IN THE RIVER SCAMANDER.[269]
line: Broad elm, and cypress rising in a spire;

Poem Title: THE BATTLE IN THE RIVER SCAMANDER.[269]
line: The watery willows hiss before the fire.

Poem Title: THE BATTLE IN THE RIVER SCAMANDER.[269]
line: Now glow the waves, the fishes pant for breath,

Poem Title: THE BATTLE IN THE RIVER SCAMANDER.[269]

THE BATTLE IN THE RIVER SCAMANDER.[269]
line: “Oh Vulcan! oh! what power resists thy might?

Poem Title: THE BATTLE IN THE RIVER SCAMANDER.[269]
line: I faint, I sink, unequal to the fight—

Poem Title: THE BATTLE IN THE RIVER SCAMANDER.[269]
line: I yield—Let Ilion fall; if fate decree—

Poem Title: THE BATTLE IN THE RIVER SCAMANDER.[269]
line: Ah—bend no more thy fiery arms on me!”

Poem Title: THE BATTLE IN THE RIVER SCAMANDER.[269]
THE BATTLE IN THE RIVER SCAMANDER.[269]
line: He ceased; wide conflagration blazing round;

Poem Title: THE BATTLE IN THE RIVER SCAMANDER.[269]
line: The bubbling waters yield a hissing sound.

Poem Title: THE BATTLE IN THE RIVER SCAMANDER.[269]
line: As when the flames beneath a cauldron rise,[272]

Poem Title: THE BATTLE IN THE RIVER SCAMANDER.[269]
line: To melt the fat of some rich sacrifice,

Poem Title: THE BATTLE IN THE RIVER SCAMANDER.[269]
line: Amid the fierce embrace of circling fires

line: The waters foam, the heavy smoke aspires:

line: So boils the imprison’d flood, forbid to flow,

line: And choked with vapours feels his bottom glow.

Poem Title: THE BATTLE IN THE RIVER SCAMANDER.[269]
line: To Juno then, imperial queen of air,

line: “Ah why, Saturnia; must thy son engage

Poem Title: THE BATTLE IN THE RIVER SCAMANDER.[269]
line: Me, only me, with all his wasteful rage?

line: On other gods his dreadful arm employ,

line: For mightier gods assert the cause of Troy.

line: Submissive I desist, if thou command;

Poem Title: THE BATTLE IN THE RIVER SCAMANDER.[269]
line: But ah! withdraw this all-destroying hand.

Poem Title: THE BATTLE IN THE RIVER SCAMANDER.[269]
line: Hear then my solemn oath, to yield to fate

Poem Title: THE BATTLE IN THE RIVER SCAMANDER.[269]
line: Unaided Ilion, and her destined state,

Poem Title: THE BATTLE IN THE RIVER SCAMANDER.[269]
line: Till Greece shall gird her with destructive flame,

Poem Title: THE BATTLE IN THE RIVER SCAMANDER.[269]
line: And in one ruin sink the Trojan name.”

line: His warm entreaty touch’d Saturnia’s ear:

line: She bade the ignipotent his rage forbear,

line: And soft remurmur in their wonted bed.

line: While these by Juno’s will the strife resign,

line: The warring gods in fierce contention join:

line: And wide beneath them groans the rending ground.

line: The power of battles lifts his brazen spear,

line: Thy impious hand Tydides’ javelin bore,

line: And madly bathed it in celestial gore.”

line: He spoke, and smote the long-resounding shield,

line: Which bears Jove’s thunder on its dreadful field:

line: The adamantine ægis of her sire,

line: That turns the glancing bolt and forked fire.

line: There fix’d from eldest times; black, craggy, vast;

line: This at the heavenly homicide she cast.

line: Thundering he falls, a mass of monstrous size:

line: And seven broad acres covers as he lies.

line: The stunning stroke his stubborn nerves unbound:

line: Loud o’er the fields his ringing arms resound:

line: The scornful dame her conquest views with smiles,

line: And, glorying, thus the prostrate god reviles:

line: “Hast thou not yet, insatiate fury! known

line: How far Minerva’s force transcends thy own?

line: Juno, whom thou rebellious darest withstand,

line: Corrects thy folly thus by Pallas’ hand;

line: Thus meets thy broken faith with just disgrace,

Poem Title: THE BATTLE IN THE RIVER SCAMANDER.[269]
line: And partial aid to Troy’s perfidious race.”

line: The goddess spoke, and turn’d her eyes away,

Poem Title: THE BATTLE IN THE RIVER SCAMANDER.[269]
line: That, beaming round, diffused celestial day.

line: Jove’s Cyprian daughter, stooping on the land,

line: Lent to the wounded god her tender hand:

line: Slowly he rises, scarcely breathes with pain,

line: And, propp’d on her fair arm, forsakes the plain.

line: This the bright empress of the heavens survey’d,

line: And, scoffing, thus to war’s victorious maid:

THE BATTLE IN THE RIVER SCAMANDER.[269]
line: “Lo! what an aid on Mars’s side is seen!

Poem Title: THE BATTLE IN THE RIVER SCAMANDER.[269]
line: The smiles’ and loves’ unconquerable queen!

Poem Title: THE BATTLE IN THE RIVER SCAMANDER.[269]
line: Mark with what insolence, in open view,

Poem Title: THE BATTLE IN THE RIVER SCAMANDER.[269]
line: She moves: let Pallas, if she dares, pursue.”

Poem Title: THE BATTLE IN THE RIVER SCAMANDER.[269]
THE BATTLE IN THE RIVER SCAMANDER.[269]
line: Minerva smiling heard, the pair o’ertook,

Poem Title: THE BATTLE IN THE RIVER SCAMANDER.[269]
line: And slightly on her breast the wanton strook:
