line: She, unresisting, fell (her spirits fled);

Poem Title: THE BATTLE IN THE RIVER SCAMANDER.[269]
line: On earth together lay the lovers spread.

Poem Title: THE BATTLE IN THE RIVER SCAMANDER.[269]
line: “And like these heroes be the fate of all

Poem Title: THE BATTLE IN THE RIVER SCAMANDER.[269]
line: (Minerva cries) who guard the Trojan wall!

Poem Title: THE BATTLE IN THE RIVER SCAMANDER.[269]
line: To Grecian gods such let the Phrygian be,

Poem Title: THE BATTLE IN THE RIVER SCAMANDER.[269]
line: So dread, so fierce, as Venus is to me;

Poem Title: THE BATTLE IN THE RIVER SCAMANDER.[269]
line: Then from the lowest stone shall Troy be moved.”

Poem Title: THE BATTLE IN THE RIVER SCAMANDER.[269]
line: Thus she, and Juno with a smile approved.

Poem Title: THE BATTLE IN THE RIVER SCAMANDER.[269]
THE BATTLE IN THE RIVER SCAMANDER.[269]
line: Meantime, to mix in more than mortal fight,

Poem Title: THE BATTLE IN THE RIVER SCAMANDER.[269]
line: The god of ocean dares the god of light.

Poem Title: THE BATTLE IN THE RIVER SCAMANDER.[269]
line: “What sloth has seized us, when the fields around

Poem Title: THE BATTLE IN THE RIVER SCAMANDER.[269]
line: Ring with conflicting powers, and heaven returns the sound:

Poem Title: THE BATTLE IN THE RIVER SCAMANDER.[269]
line: Shall, ignominious, we with shame retire,

Poem Title: THE BATTLE IN THE RIVER SCAMANDER.[269]
line: No deed perform’d, to our Olympian sire?

Poem Title: THE BATTLE IN THE RIVER SCAMANDER.[269]
line: Come, prove thy arm! for first the war to wage,

Poem Title: THE BATTLE IN THE RIVER SCAMANDER.[269]
line: Suits not my greatness, or superior age:

Poem Title: THE BATTLE IN THE RIVER SCAMANDER.[269]
line: Rash as thou art to prop the Trojan throne,

Poem Title: THE BATTLE IN THE RIVER SCAMANDER.[269]
line: (Forgetful of my wrongs, and of thy own,)

Poem Title: THE BATTLE IN THE RIVER SCAMANDER.[269]
line: And guard the race of proud Laomedon!

Poem Title: THE BATTLE IN THE RIVER SCAMANDER.[269]
line: Hast thou forgot, how, at the monarch’s prayer,

Poem Title: THE BATTLE IN THE RIVER SCAMANDER.[269]
line: We shared the lengthen’d labours of a year?

Poem Title: THE BATTLE IN THE RIVER SCAMANDER.[269]
line: Troy walls I raised (for such were Jove’s commands),

Poem Title: THE BATTLE IN THE RIVER SCAMANDER.[269]
line: And yon proud bulwarks grew beneath my hands:

Poem Title: THE BATTLE IN THE RIVER SCAMANDER.[269]
line: Thy task it was to feed the bellowing droves

Poem Title: THE BATTLE IN THE RIVER SCAMANDER.[269]
line: Along fair Ida’s vales and pendant groves.

Poem Title: THE BATTLE IN THE RIVER SCAMANDER.[269]
line: But when the circling seasons in their train

Poem Title: THE BATTLE IN THE RIVER SCAMANDER.[269]
line: Brought back the grateful day that crown’d our pain,

Poem Title: THE BATTLE IN THE RIVER SCAMANDER.[269]
line: With menace stern the fraudful king defied

Poem Title: THE BATTLE IN THE RIVER SCAMANDER.[269]
line: Our latent godhead, and the prize denied:

Poem Title: THE BATTLE IN THE RIVER SCAMANDER.[269]
line: Mad as he was, he threaten’d servile bands,

Poem Title: THE BATTLE IN THE RIVER SCAMANDER.[269]
line: And doom’d us exiles far in barbarous lands.[273]

Poem Title: THE BATTLE IN THE RIVER SCAMANDER.[269]
line: Incensed, we heavenward fled with swiftest wing,

Poem Title: THE BATTLE IN THE RIVER SCAMANDER.[269]
line: And destined vengeance on the perjured king.

Poem Title: THE BATTLE IN THE RIVER SCAMANDER.[269]
line: Dost thou, for this, afford proud Ilion grace,

Poem Title: THE BATTLE IN THE RIVER SCAMANDER.[269]
line: And not, like us, infest the faithless race;

Poem Title: THE BATTLE IN THE RIVER SCAMANDER.[269]
line: Like us, their present, future sons destroy,

Poem Title: THE BATTLE IN THE RIVER SCAMANDER.[269]
line: And from its deep foundations heave their Troy?”

Poem Title: THE BATTLE IN THE RIVER SCAMANDER.[269]
THE BATTLE IN THE RIVER SCAMANDER.[269]
line: Apollo thus: “To combat for mankind

Poem Title: THE BATTLE IN THE RIVER SCAMANDER.[269]
line: Ill suits the wisdom of celestial mind;

Poem Title: THE BATTLE IN THE RIVER SCAMANDER.[269]
line: For what is man? Calamitous by birth,

Poem Title: THE BATTLE IN THE RIVER SCAMANDER.[269]
line: They owe their life and nourishment to earth;

Poem Title: THE BATTLE IN THE RIVER SCAMANDER.[269]
line: Like yearly leaves, that now, with beauty crown’d,

Poem Title: THE BATTLE IN THE RIVER SCAMANDER.[269]
line: Smile on the sun; now, wither on the ground.

Poem Title: THE BATTLE IN THE RIVER SCAMANDER.[269]
line: To their own hands commit the frantic scene,

Poem Title: THE BATTLE IN THE RIVER SCAMANDER.[269]
line: Nor mix immortals in a cause so mean.”

Poem Title: THE BATTLE IN THE RIVER SCAMANDER.[269]
THE BATTLE IN THE RIVER SCAMANDER.[269]
line: Then turns his face, far-beaming heavenly fires,

Poem Title: THE BATTLE IN THE RIVER SCAMANDER.[269]
line: And from the senior power submiss retires:

Poem Title: THE BATTLE IN THE RIVER SCAMANDER.[269]
line: Him thus retreating, Artemis upbraids,

Poem Title: THE BATTLE IN THE RIVER SCAMANDER.[269]
line: The quiver’d huntress of the sylvan shades:

Poem Title: THE BATTLE IN THE RIVER SCAMANDER.[269]
THE BATTLE IN THE RIVER SCAMANDER.[269]
line: “And is it thus the youthful Phœbus flies,

Poem Title: THE BATTLE IN THE RIVER SCAMANDER.[269]
line: And yields to ocean’s hoary sire the prize?

Poem Title: THE BATTLE IN THE RIVER SCAMANDER.[269]
line: How vain that martial pomp, and dreadful show

Poem Title: THE BATTLE IN THE RIVER SCAMANDER.[269]
line: Of pointed arrows and the silver bow!

Poem Title: THE BATTLE IN THE RIVER SCAMANDER.[269]
line: Now boast no more in yon celestial bower,

Poem Title: THE BATTLE IN THE RIVER SCAMANDER.[269]
line: Thy force can match the great earth-shaking power.”

Poem Title: THE BATTLE IN THE RIVER SCAMANDER.[269]
THE BATTLE IN THE RIVER SCAMANDER.[269]
line: Silent he heard the queen of woods upbraid:

Poem Title: THE BATTLE IN THE RIVER SCAMANDER.[269]
line: Not so Saturnia bore the vaunting maid:

Poem Title: THE BATTLE IN THE RIVER SCAMANDER.[269]
line: But furious thus: “What insolence has driven

Poem Title: THE BATTLE IN THE RIVER SCAMANDER.[269]
line: Thy pride to face the majesty of heaven?

Poem Title: THE BATTLE IN THE RIVER SCAMANDER.[269]
line: What though by Jove the female plague design’d,

Poem Title: THE BATTLE IN THE RIVER SCAMANDER.[269]
line: Fierce to the feeble race of womankind,

Poem Title: THE BATTLE IN THE RIVER SCAMANDER.[269]
line: The wretched matron feels thy piercing dart;

Poem Title: THE BATTLE IN THE RIVER SCAMANDER.[269]
line: Thy sex’s tyrant, with a tiger’s heart?

Poem Title: THE BATTLE IN THE RIVER SCAMANDER.[269]
line: What though tremendous in the woodland chase

Poem Title: THE BATTLE IN THE RIVER SCAMANDER.[269]
line: Thy certain arrows pierce the savage race?

Poem Title: THE BATTLE IN THE RIVER SCAMANDER.[269]
line: How dares thy rashness on the powers divine

Poem Title: THE BATTLE IN THE RIVER SCAMANDER.[269]
line: Employ those arms, or match thy force with mine?

Poem Title: THE BATTLE IN THE RIVER SCAMANDER.[269]
line: Learn hence, no more unequal war to wage—”

Poem Title: THE BATTLE IN THE RIVER SCAMANDER.[269]
line: She said, and seized her wrists with eager rage;

Poem Title: THE BATTLE IN THE RIVER SCAMANDER.[269]
line: These in her left hand lock’d, her right untied

Poem Title: THE BATTLE IN THE RIVER SCAMANDER.[269]
line: The bow, the quiver, and its plumy pride.

Poem Title: THE BATTLE IN THE RIVER SCAMANDER.[269]
line: About her temples flies the busy bow;

Poem Title: THE BATTLE IN THE RIVER SCAMANDER.[269]
line: Now here, now there, she winds her from the blow;

Poem Title: THE BATTLE IN THE RIVER SCAMANDER.[269]
line: The scattering arrows, rattling from the case,

Poem Title: THE BATTLE IN THE RIVER SCAMANDER.[269]
line: Drop round, and idly mark the dusty place.

Poem Title: THE BATTLE IN THE RIVER SCAMANDER.[269]
line: Swift from the field the baffled huntress flies,

Poem Title: THE BATTLE IN THE RIVER SCAMANDER.[269]
line: And scarce restrains the torrent in her eyes:

Poem Title: THE BATTLE IN THE RIVER SCAMANDER.[269]
line: So, when the falcon wings her way above,

Poem Title: THE BATTLE IN THE RIVER SCAMANDER.[269]
line: To the cleft cavern speeds the gentle dove;

Poem Title: THE BATTLE IN THE RIVER SCAMANDER.[269]
line: (Not fated yet to die;) there safe retreats,

Poem Title: THE BATTLE IN THE RIVER SCAMANDER.[269]
line: Yet still her heart against the marble beats.

Poem Title: THE BATTLE IN THE RIVER SCAMANDER.[269]
THE BATTLE IN THE RIVER SCAMANDER.[269]
line: To her Latona hastes with tender care;

Poem Title: THE BATTLE IN THE RIVER SCAMANDER.[269]
line: Whom Hermes viewing, thus declines the war:

Poem Title: THE BATTLE IN THE RIVER SCAMANDER.[269]
line: “How shall I face the dame, who gives delight

Poem Title: THE BATTLE IN THE RIVER SCAMANDER.[269]
line: To him whose thunders blacken heaven with night?

Poem Title: THE BATTLE IN THE RIVER SCAMANDER.[269]
line: Go, matchless goddess! triumph in the skies,

Poem Title: THE BATTLE IN THE RIVER SCAMANDER.[269]
line: And boast my conquest, while I yield the prize.”

Poem Title: THE BATTLE IN THE RIVER SCAMANDER.[269]
THE BATTLE IN THE RIVER SCAMANDER.[269]
line: He spoke; and pass’d: Latona, stooping low,

Poem Title: THE BATTLE IN THE RIVER SCAMANDER.[269]
line: Collects the scatter’d shafts and fallen bow,

Poem Title: THE BATTLE IN THE RIVER SCAMANDER.[269]
line: That, glittering on the dust, lay here and there

Poem Title: THE BATTLE IN THE RIVER SCAMANDER.[269]
line: Dishonour’d relics of Diana’s war:

Poem Title: THE BATTLE IN THE RIVER SCAMANDER.[269]
line: Then swift pursued her to her blest abode,

Poem Title: THE BATTLE IN THE RIVER SCAMANDER.[269]
line: Where, all confused, she sought the sovereign god;

Poem Title: THE BATTLE IN THE RIVER SCAMANDER.[269]
line: Weeping, she grasp’d his knees: the ambrosial vest

Poem Title: THE BATTLE IN THE RIVER SCAMANDER.[269]
line: Shook with her sighs, and panted on her breast.

Poem Title: THE BATTLE IN THE RIVER SCAMANDER.[269]
THE BATTLE IN THE RIVER SCAMANDER.[269]
line: The sire superior smiled, and bade her show

Poem Title: THE BATTLE IN THE RIVER SCAMANDER.[269]
line: What heavenly hand had caused his daughter’s woe?

Poem Title: THE BATTLE IN THE RIVER SCAMANDER.[269]
line: Abash’d, she names his own imperial spouse;

Poem Title: THE BATTLE IN THE RIVER SCAMANDER.[269]
line: And the pale crescent fades upon her brows.

Poem Title: THE BATTLE IN THE RIVER SCAMANDER.[269]
THE BATTLE IN THE RIVER SCAMANDER.[269]
line: Thus they above: while, swiftly gliding down,

Poem Title: THE BATTLE IN THE RIVER SCAMANDER.[269]
line: Apollo enters Ilion’s sacred town;

Poem Title: THE BATTLE IN THE RIVER SCAMANDER.[269]
line: The guardian-god now trembled for her wall,

Poem Title: THE BATTLE IN THE RIVER SCAMANDER.[269]
line: And fear’d the Greeks, though fate forbade her fall.

Poem Title: THE BATTLE IN THE RIVER SCAMANDER.[269]
line: Back to Olympus, from the war’s alarms,

Poem Title: THE BATTLE IN THE RIVER SCAMANDER.[269]
line: Return the shining bands of gods in arms;

Poem Title: THE BATTLE IN THE RIVER SCAMANDER.[269]
line: Some proud in triumph, some with rage on fire;

Poem Title: THE BATTLE IN THE RIVER SCAMANDER.[269]
line: And take their thrones around the ethereal sire.

Poem Title: THE BATTLE IN THE RIVER SCAMANDER.[269]
THE BATTLE IN THE RIVER SCAMANDER.[269]
line: Through blood, through death, Achilles still proceeds,

Poem Title: THE BATTLE IN THE RIVER SCAMANDER.[269]
line: O’er slaughter’d heroes, and o’er rolling steeds.

Poem Title: THE BATTLE IN THE RIVER SCAMANDER.[269]
line: As when avenging flames with fury driven

Poem Title: THE BATTLE IN THE RIVER SCAMANDER.[269]
line: On guilty towns exert the wrath of heaven;

Poem Title: THE BATTLE IN THE RIVER SCAMANDER.[269]
line: The pale inhabitants, some fall, some fly;

Poem Title: THE BATTLE IN THE RIVER SCAMANDER.[269]
line: And the red vapours purple all the sky:

Poem Title: THE BATTLE IN THE RIVER SCAMANDER.[269]
line: So raged Achilles: death and dire dismay,

Poem Title: THE BATTLE IN THE RIVER SCAMANDER.[269]
line: And toils, and terrors, fill’d the dreadful day.

Poem Title: THE BATTLE IN THE RIVER SCAMANDER.[269]
THE BATTLE IN THE RIVER SCAMANDER.[269]
line: High on a turret hoary Priam stands,

Poem Title: THE BATTLE IN THE RIVER SCAMANDER.[269]
line: And marks the waste of his destructive hands;

Poem Title: THE BATTLE IN THE RIVER SCAMANDER.[269]
line: Views, from his arm, the Trojans’ scatter’d flight,

Poem Title: THE BATTLE IN THE RIVER SCAMANDER.[269]
line: And the near hero rising on his sight!

Poem Title: THE BATTLE IN THE RIVER SCAMANDER.[269]
line: No stop, no check, no aid! With feeble pace,

Poem Title: THE BATTLE IN THE RIVER SCAMANDER.[269]
line: And settled sorrow on his aged face,

Poem Title: THE BATTLE IN THE RIVER SCAMANDER.[269]
line: Fast as he could, he sighing quits the walls;

Poem Title: THE BATTLE IN THE RIVER SCAMANDER.[269]
line: And thus descending, on the guards he calls:

Poem Title: THE BATTLE IN THE RIVER SCAMANDER.[269]
THE BATTLE IN THE RIVER SCAMANDER.[269]
line: “You to whose care our city-gates belong,

Poem Title: THE BATTLE IN THE RIVER SCAMANDER.[269]
line: Set wide your portals to the flying throng:

Poem Title: THE BATTLE IN THE RIVER SCAMANDER.[269]
line: For lo! he comes, with unresisted sway;

Poem Title: THE BATTLE IN THE RIVER SCAMANDER.[269]
line: He comes, and desolation marks his way!

Poem Title: THE BATTLE IN THE RIVER SCAMANDER.[269]
line: But when within the walls our troops take breath,

Poem Title: THE BATTLE IN THE RIVER SCAMANDER.[269]
line: Lock fast the brazen bars, and shut out death.”

Poem Title: THE BATTLE IN THE RIVER SCAMANDER.[269]
line: Thus charged the reverend monarch: wide were flung

Poem Title: THE BATTLE IN THE RIVER SCAMANDER.[269]
line: The opening folds; the sounding hinges rung.

Poem Title: THE BATTLE IN THE RIVER SCAMANDER.[269]
line: Phœbus rush’d forth, the flying bands to meet;

Poem Title: THE BATTLE IN THE RIVER SCAMANDER.[269]
line: Struck slaughter back, and cover’d the retreat,

Poem Title: THE BATTLE IN THE RIVER SCAMANDER.[269]
line: On heaps the Trojans crowd to gain the gate,

Poem Title: THE BATTLE IN THE RIVER SCAMANDER.[269]
line: And gladsome see their last escape from fate.

Poem Title: THE BATTLE IN THE RIVER SCAMANDER.[269]
line: Thither, all parch’d with thirst, a heartless train,

Poem Title: THE BATTLE IN THE RIVER SCAMANDER.[269]
line: Hoary with dust, they beat the hollow plain:

Poem Title: THE BATTLE IN THE RIVER SCAMANDER.[269]
line: And gasping, panting, fainting, labour on

Poem Title: THE BATTLE IN THE RIVER SCAMANDER.[269]
line: With heavier strides, that lengthen toward the town.

Poem Title: THE BATTLE IN THE RIVER SCAMANDER.[269]
line: Enraged Achilles follows with his spear;

Poem Title: THE BATTLE IN THE RIVER SCAMANDER.[269]
line: Wild with revenge, insatiable of war.

Poem Title: THE BATTLE IN THE RIVER SCAMANDER.[269]
THE BATTLE IN THE RIVER SCAMANDER.[269]
line: Then had the Greeks eternal praise acquired,

Poem Title: THE BATTLE IN THE RIVER SCAMANDER.[269]
line: And Troy inglorious to her walls retired;

Poem Title: THE BATTLE IN THE RIVER SCAMANDER.[269]
line: But he, the god who darts ethereal flame,

Poem Title: THE BATTLE IN THE RIVER SCAMANDER.[269]
line: Shot down to save her, and redeem her fame:

Poem Title: THE BATTLE IN THE RIVER SCAMANDER.[269]
line: To young Agenor force divine he gave;

Poem Title: THE BATTLE IN THE RIVER SCAMANDER.[269]
line: (Antenor’s offspring, haughty, bold, and brave;)

Poem Title: THE BATTLE IN THE RIVER SCAMANDER.[269]
line: In aid of him, beside the beech he sate,

Poem Title: THE BATTLE IN THE RIVER SCAMANDER.[269]
line: And wrapt in clouds, restrain’d the hand of fate.

Poem Title: THE BATTLE IN THE RIVER SCAMANDER.[269]
line: When now the generous youth Achilles spies,

Poem Title: THE BATTLE IN THE RIVER SCAMANDER.[269]
line: Thick beats his heart, the troubled motions rise.

Poem Title: THE BATTLE IN THE RIVER SCAMANDER.[269]
line: (So, ere a storm, the waters heave and roll.)

Poem Title: THE BATTLE IN THE RIVER SCAMANDER.[269]
line: He stops, and questions thus his mighty soul;

Poem Title: THE BATTLE IN THE RIVER SCAMANDER.[269]
THE BATTLE IN THE RIVER SCAMANDER.[269]
line: “What, shall I fly this terror of the plain!

Poem Title: THE BATTLE IN THE RIVER SCAMANDER.[269]
line: Like others fly, and be like others slain?

Poem Title: THE BATTLE IN THE RIVER SCAMANDER.[269]
line: Vain hope! to shun him by the self-same road

Poem Title: THE BATTLE IN THE RIVER SCAMANDER.[269]
line: Yon line of slaughter’d Trojans lately trod.

Poem Title: THE BATTLE IN THE RIVER SCAMANDER.[269]
line: No: with the common heap I scorn to fall—

Poem Title: THE BATTLE IN THE RIVER SCAMANDER.[269]
line: What if they pass’d me to the Trojan wall,

Poem Title: THE BATTLE IN THE RIVER SCAMANDER.[269]
line: While I decline to yonder path, that leads

Poem Title: THE BATTLE IN THE RIVER SCAMANDER.[269]
line: To Ida’s forests and surrounding shades?

Poem Title: THE BATTLE IN THE RIVER SCAMANDER.[269]
line: So may I reach, conceal’d, the cooling flood,

Poem Title: THE BATTLE IN THE RIVER SCAMANDER.[269]
line: From my tired body wash the dirt and blood,

Poem Title: THE BATTLE IN THE RIVER SCAMANDER.[269]
line: As soon as night her dusky veil extends,

Poem Title: THE BATTLE IN THE RIVER SCAMANDER.[269]
line: Return in safety to my Trojan friends.

Poem Title: THE BATTLE IN THE RIVER SCAMANDER.[269]
line: What if?—But wherefore all this vain debate?

Poem Title: THE BATTLE IN THE RIVER SCAMANDER.[269]
line: Stand I to doubt, within the reach of fate?

Poem Title: THE BATTLE IN THE RIVER SCAMANDER.[269]
line: Even now perhaps, ere yet I turn the wall,

Poem Title: THE BATTLE IN THE RIVER SCAMANDER.[269]
line: The fierce Achilles sees me, and I fall:

Poem Title: THE BATTLE IN THE RIVER SCAMANDER.[269]
line: Such is his swiftness, ’tis in vain to fly,

Poem Title: THE BATTLE IN THE RIVER SCAMANDER.[269]
line: And such his valour, that who stands must die.

Poem Title: THE BATTLE IN THE RIVER SCAMANDER.[269]
line: Howe’er ’tis better, fighting for the state,

Poem Title: THE BATTLE IN THE RIVER SCAMANDER.[269]
line: Here, and in public view, to meet my fate.

Poem Title: THE BATTLE IN THE RIVER SCAMANDER.[269]
line: Yet sure he too is mortal; he may feel

Poem Title: THE BATTLE IN THE RIVER SCAMANDER.[269]
line: (Like all the sons of earth) the force of steel.

Poem Title: THE BATTLE IN THE RIVER SCAMANDER.[269]
line: One only soul informs that dreadful frame:

Poem Title: THE BATTLE IN THE RIVER SCAMANDER.[269]
line: And Jove’s sole favour gives him all his fame.”

Poem Title: THE BATTLE IN THE RIVER SCAMANDER.[269]
THE BATTLE IN THE RIVER SCAMANDER.[269]
line: He said, and stood, collected, in his might;

Poem Title: THE BATTLE IN THE RIVER SCAMANDER.[269]
line: And all his beating bosom claim’d the fight.

Poem Title: THE BATTLE IN THE RIVER SCAMANDER.[269]
line: So from some deep-grown wood a panther starts,

Poem Title: THE BATTLE IN THE RIVER SCAMANDER.[269]
line: Roused from his thicket by a storm of darts:

Poem Title: THE BATTLE IN THE RIVER SCAMANDER.[269]
line: Untaught to fear or fly, he hears the sounds

Poem Title: THE BATTLE IN THE RIVER SCAMANDER.[269]
line: Of shouting hunters, and of clamorous hounds;

Poem Title: THE BATTLE IN THE RIVER SCAMANDER.[269]
line: Though struck, though wounded, scarce perceives the pain;

Poem Title: THE BATTLE IN THE RIVER SCAMANDER.[269]
line: And the barb’d javelin stings his breast in vain:

Poem Title: THE BATTLE IN THE RIVER SCAMANDER.[269]
line: On their whole war, untamed, the savage flies;

Poem Title: THE BATTLE IN THE RIVER SCAMANDER.[269]
line: And tears his hunter, or beneath him dies.

Poem Title: THE BATTLE IN THE RIVER SCAMANDER.[269]
line: Not less resolved, Antenor’s valiant heir

Poem Title: THE BATTLE IN THE RIVER SCAMANDER.[269]
line: Confronts Achilles, and awaits the war,

Poem Title: THE BATTLE IN THE RIVER SCAMANDER.[269]
line: Disdainful of retreat: high held before,

Poem Title: THE BATTLE IN THE RIVER SCAMANDER.[269]
line: His shield (a broad circumference) he bore;

Poem Title: THE BATTLE IN THE RIVER SCAMANDER.[269]
line: Then graceful as he stood, in act to throw

Poem Title: THE BATTLE IN THE RIVER SCAMANDER.[269]
line: The lifted javelin, thus bespoke the foe:

Poem Title: THE BATTLE IN THE RIVER SCAMANDER.[269]
THE BATTLE IN THE RIVER SCAMANDER.[269]
line: “How proud Achilles glories in his fame!

Poem Title: THE BATTLE IN THE RIVER SCAMANDER.[269]
line: And hopes this day to sink the Trojan name

Poem Title: THE BATTLE IN THE RIVER SCAMANDER.[269]
line: Beneath her ruins! Know, that hope is vain;

Poem Title: THE BATTLE IN THE RIVER SCAMANDER.[269]
line: A thousand woes, a thousand toils remain.

Poem Title: THE BATTLE IN THE RIVER SCAMANDER.[269]
line: Parents and children our just arms employ,

Poem Title: THE BATTLE IN THE RIVER SCAMANDER.[269]
line: And strong and many are the sons of Troy.

Poem Title: THE BATTLE IN THE RIVER SCAMANDER.[269]
line: Great as thou art, even thou may’st stain with gore

Poem Title: THE BATTLE IN THE RIVER SCAMANDER.[269]
line: These Phrygian fields, and press a foreign shore.”

Poem Title: THE BATTLE IN THE RIVER SCAMANDER.[269]
THE BATTLE IN THE RIVER SCAMANDER.[269]
line: He said: with matchless force the javelin flung

Poem Title: THE BATTLE IN THE RIVER SCAMANDER.[269]
line: Smote on his knee; the hollow cuishes rung

Poem Title: THE BATTLE IN THE RIVER SCAMANDER.[269]
line: Beneath the pointed steel; but safe from harms

Poem Title: THE BATTLE IN THE RIVER SCAMANDER.[269]
line: He stands impassive in the ethereal arms.

Poem Title: THE BATTLE IN THE RIVER SCAMANDER.[269]
line: Then fiercely rushing on the daring foe,

Poem Title: THE BATTLE IN THE RIVER SCAMANDER.[269]
line: His lifted arm prepares the fatal blow:

Poem Title: THE BATTLE IN THE RIVER SCAMANDER.[269]
line: But, jealous of his fame, Apollo shrouds

Poem Title: THE BATTLE IN THE RIVER SCAMANDER.[269]
line: The god-like Trojan in a veil of clouds.

Poem Title: THE BATTLE IN THE RIVER SCAMANDER.[269]
line: Safe from pursuit, and shut from mortal view,

Poem Title: THE BATTLE IN THE RIVER SCAMANDER.[269]
line: Dismiss’d with fame, the favoured youth withdrew.

Poem Title: THE BATTLE IN THE RIVER SCAMANDER.[269]
line: Meanwhile the god, to cover their escape,

Poem Title: THE BATTLE IN THE RIVER SCAMANDER.[269]
line: Assumes Agenor’s habit, voice and shape,

Poem Title: THE BATTLE IN THE RIVER SCAMANDER.[269]
line: Flies from the furious chief in this disguise;

Poem Title: THE BATTLE IN THE RIVER SCAMANDER.[269]
line: The furious chief still follows where he flies.

Poem Title: THE BATTLE IN THE RIVER SCAMANDER.[269]
line: Now o’er the fields they stretch with lengthen’d strides,

Poem Title: THE BATTLE IN THE RIVER SCAMANDER.[269]
line: Now urge the course where swift Scamander glides:

Poem Title: THE BATTLE IN THE RIVER SCAMANDER.[269]
line: The god, now distant scarce a stride before,

Poem Title: THE BATTLE IN THE RIVER SCAMANDER.[269]
line: Tempts his pursuit, and wheels about the shore;

Poem Title: THE BATTLE IN THE RIVER SCAMANDER.[269]
line: While all the flying troops their speed employ,

Poem Title: THE BATTLE IN THE RIVER SCAMANDER.[269]
line: And pour on heaps into the walls of Troy:

Poem Title: THE BATTLE IN THE RIVER SCAMANDER.[269]
line: No stop, no stay; no thought to ask, or tell,

Poem Title: THE BATTLE IN THE RIVER SCAMANDER.[269]
line: Who ’scaped by flight, or who by battle fell.

Poem Title: THE BATTLE IN THE RIVER SCAMANDER.[269]
line: ’Twas tumult all, and violence of flight;

Poem Title: THE BATTLE IN THE RIVER SCAMANDER.[269]
line: And sudden joy confused, and mix’d affright.

Poem Title: THE BATTLE IN THE RIVER SCAMANDER.[269]
line: Pale Troy against Achilles shuts her gate:

Poem Title: THE BATTLE IN THE RIVER SCAMANDER.[269]
line: And nations breathe, deliver’d from their fate.

Poem Title: THE BATTLE IN THE RIVER SCAMANDER.[269]
THE BATTLE IN THE RIVER SCAMANDER.[269]
THE BATTLE IN THE RIVER SCAMANDER.[269]

THE DEATH OF HECTOR.
line: THE DEATH OF HECTOR.

Poem Title: THE DEATH OF HECTOR.
THE DEATH OF HECTOR.
THE DEATH OF HECTOR.
line: The Trojans being safe within the walls, Hector only stays to oppose

Poem Title: THE DEATH OF HECTOR.
line: Achilles. Priam is struck at his approach, and tries to persuade his

Poem Title: THE DEATH OF HECTOR.
line: son to re-enter the town. Hecuba joins her entreaties, but in vain.

Poem Title: THE DEATH OF HECTOR.
line: Hector consults within himself what measures to take; but at the

Poem Title: THE DEATH OF HECTOR.
line: advance of Achilles, his resolution fails him, and he flies. Achilles

Poem Title: THE DEATH OF HECTOR.
line: pursues him thrice round the walls of Troy. The gods debate concerning

Poem Title: THE DEATH OF HECTOR.
line: the fate of Hector; at length Minerva descends to the aid of Achilles.

Poem Title: THE DEATH OF HECTOR.
line: She deludes Hector in the shape of Deiphobus; he stands the combat, and

Poem Title: THE DEATH OF HECTOR.
line: is slain. Achilles drags the dead body at his chariot in the sight of

Poem Title: THE DEATH OF HECTOR.
line: Priam and Hecuba. Their lamentations, tears, and despair. Their cries

Poem Title: THE DEATH OF HECTOR.
line: reach the ears of Andromache, who, ignorant of this, was retired into

Poem Title: THE DEATH OF HECTOR.
line: the inner part of the palace: she mounts up to the walls, and beholds

Poem Title: THE DEATH OF HECTOR.
line: her dead husband. She swoons at the spectacle. Her excess of grief and

Poem Title: THE DEATH OF HECTOR.
line: lamentation.

Poem Title: THE DEATH OF HECTOR.
line: The thirtieth day still continues. The scene lies under the walls,

Poem Title: THE DEATH OF HECTOR.
line: and on the battlements of Troy.

Poem Title: THE DEATH OF HECTOR.
THE DEATH OF HECTOR.
THE DEATH OF HECTOR.
line: Thus to their bulwarks, smit with panic fear,

Poem Title: THE DEATH OF HECTOR.
line: The herded Ilians rush like driven deer:

Poem Title: THE DEATH OF HECTOR.
line: There safe they wipe the briny drops away,

Poem Title: THE DEATH OF HECTOR.
line: And drown in bowls the labours of the day.

Poem Title: THE DEATH OF HECTOR.
line: Close to the walls, advancing o’er the fields

Poem Title: THE DEATH OF HECTOR.
line: Beneath one roof of well-compacted shields,

Poem Title: THE DEATH OF HECTOR.
line: March, bending on, the Greeks’ embodied powers,

Poem Title: THE DEATH OF HECTOR.
line: Far stretching in the shade of Trojan towers.

Poem Title: THE DEATH OF HECTOR.
line: Great Hector singly stay’d: chain’d down by fate

Poem Title: THE DEATH OF HECTOR.
line: There fix’d he stood before the Scæan gate;

Poem Title: THE DEATH OF HECTOR.
line: Still his bold arms determined to employ,

Poem Title: THE DEATH OF HECTOR.
line: The guardian still of long-defended Troy.

Poem Title: THE DEATH OF HECTOR.
THE DEATH OF HECTOR.
line: Apollo now to tired Achilles turns:

Poem Title: THE DEATH OF HECTOR.
line: (The power confess’d in all his glory burns:)

Poem Title: THE DEATH OF HECTOR.
line: “And what (he cries) has Peleus’ son in view,

Poem Title: THE DEATH OF HECTOR.
line: With mortal speed a godhead to pursue?

Poem Title: THE DEATH OF HECTOR.
line: For not to thee to know the gods is given,

Poem Title: THE DEATH OF HECTOR.

Poem Title: FUNERAL GAMES IN HONOUR OF PATROCLUS.[280]

Poem Title: FUNERAL GAMES IN HONOUR OF PATROCLUS.[280]

line: twelve Trojan captives, at the pile; then sets fire to it. He pays

Poem Title: FUNERAL GAMES IN HONOUR OF PATROCLUS.[280]

Poem Title: FUNERAL GAMES IN HONOUR OF PATROCLUS.[280]
line: the flames. When the pile has burned all night, they gather the bones,

Poem Title: FUNERAL GAMES IN HONOUR OF PATROCLUS.[280]
line: place them in an urn of gold, and raise the tomb. Achilles institutes

Poem Title: FUNERAL GAMES IN HONOUR OF PATROCLUS.[280]
line: the funeral games: the chariot-race, the fight of the caestus, the

Poem Title: FUNERAL GAMES IN HONOUR OF PATROCLUS.[280]

Poem Title: FUNERAL GAMES IN HONOUR OF PATROCLUS.[280]
line: with arrows, the darting the javelin: the various descriptions of

Poem Title: FUNERAL GAMES IN HONOUR OF PATROCLUS.[280]
line: which, and the various success of the several antagonists, make the

Poem Title: FUNERAL GAMES IN HONOUR OF PATROCLUS.[280]
line: greatest part of the book.

line: In this book ends the thirtieth day. The night following, the ghost

Poem Title: FUNERAL GAMES IN HONOUR OF PATROCLUS.[280]

line: The bristly victims hissing o’er the fire:

line: “No drop shall touch me, by almighty Jove!

Poem Title: FUNERAL GAMES IN HONOUR OF PATROCLUS.[280]
line: The first and greatest of the gods above!

line: Till on the pyre I place thee; till I rear

line: Some ease at least those pious rites may give,

line: Howe’er, reluctant as I am, I stay

Poem Title: FUNERAL GAMES IN HONOUR OF PATROCLUS.[280]
line: And share your feast; but with the dawn of day,

line: (O king of men!) it claims thy royal care,

Poem Title: FUNERAL GAMES IN HONOUR OF PATROCLUS.[280]
line: That Greece the warrior’s funeral pile prepare,

line: And bid the forests fall: (such rites are paid

line: To heroes slumbering in eternal shade:)

line: Then, when his earthly part shall mount in fire,

line: Let the leagued squadrons to their posts retire.”

line: He spoke: they hear him, and the word obey;

line: The rage of hunger and of thirst allay,

line: Then ease in sleep the labours of the day.

line: But great Pelides, stretch’d along the shore,

line: Along the grass his languid members fall,

line: Tired with his chase around the Trojan wall;

line: Hush’d by the murmurs of the rolling deep,

line: When lo! the shade, before his closing eyes,

line: Of sad Patroclus rose, or seem’d to rise:

line: In the same robe he living wore, he came:

line: In stature, voice, and pleasing look, the same.

Poem Title: FUNERAL GAMES IN HONOUR OF PATROCLUS.[280]
line: The form familiar hover’d o’er his head,

Poem Title: FUNERAL GAMES IN HONOUR OF PATROCLUS.[280]
line: “And sleeps Achilles? (thus the phantom said:)

Poem Title: FUNERAL GAMES IN HONOUR OF PATROCLUS.[280]
line: Sleeps my Achilles, his Patroclus dead?

Poem Title: FUNERAL GAMES IN HONOUR OF PATROCLUS.[280]
line: Living, I seem’d his dearest, tenderest care,

Poem Title: FUNERAL GAMES IN HONOUR OF PATROCLUS.[280]
line: But now forgot, I wander in the air.

Poem Title: FUNERAL GAMES IN HONOUR OF PATROCLUS.[280]
line: Let my pale corse the rites of burial know,

Poem Title: FUNERAL GAMES IN HONOUR OF PATROCLUS.[280]
line: And give me entrance in the realms below:

Poem Title: FUNERAL GAMES IN HONOUR OF PATROCLUS.[280]
line: Till then the spirit finds no resting-place,

Poem Title: FUNERAL GAMES IN HONOUR OF PATROCLUS.[280]
line: But here and there the unbodied spectres chase

Poem Title: FUNERAL GAMES IN HONOUR OF PATROCLUS.[280]
line: The vagrant dead around the dark abode,

Poem Title: FUNERAL GAMES IN HONOUR OF PATROCLUS.[280]
line: Forbid to cross the irremeable flood.

Poem Title: FUNERAL GAMES IN HONOUR OF PATROCLUS.[280]
line: Now give thy hand; for to the farther shore

Poem Title: FUNERAL GAMES IN HONOUR OF PATROCLUS.[280]
line: When once we pass, the soul returns no more:

Poem Title: FUNERAL GAMES IN HONOUR OF PATROCLUS.[280]
line: When once the last funereal flames ascend,

line: No more shall meet Achilles and his friend;

line: Me fate has sever’d from the sons of earth,

Poem Title: FUNERAL GAMES IN HONOUR OF PATROCLUS.[280]
line: The fate fore-doom’d that waited from my birth:

Poem Title: FUNERAL GAMES IN HONOUR OF PATROCLUS.[280]
line: Thee too it waits; before the Trojan wall

Poem Title: FUNERAL GAMES IN HONOUR OF PATROCLUS.[280]
line: Even great and godlike thou art doom’d to fall.

Poem Title: FUNERAL GAMES IN HONOUR OF PATROCLUS.[280]
line: Hear then; and as in fate and love we join,

Poem Title: FUNERAL GAMES IN HONOUR OF PATROCLUS.[280]
line: Ah suffer that my bones may rest with thine!

Poem Title: FUNERAL GAMES IN HONOUR OF PATROCLUS.[280]
line: Together have we lived; together bred,

Poem Title: FUNERAL GAMES IN HONOUR OF PATROCLUS.[280]
line: One house received us, and one table fed;

Poem Title: FUNERAL GAMES IN HONOUR OF PATROCLUS.[280]
line: That golden urn, thy goddess-mother gave,

Poem Title: FUNERAL GAMES IN HONOUR OF PATROCLUS.[280]
line: May mix our ashes in one common grave.”

Poem Title: FUNERAL GAMES IN HONOUR OF PATROCLUS.[280]
FUNERAL GAMES IN HONOUR OF PATROCLUS.[280]
line: “And is it thou? (he answers) To my sight[283]

Poem Title: FUNERAL GAMES IN HONOUR OF PATROCLUS.[280]
line: Once more return’st thou from the realms of night?

Poem Title: FUNERAL GAMES IN HONOUR OF PATROCLUS.[280]
line: O more than brother! Think each office paid,

Poem Title: FUNERAL GAMES IN HONOUR OF PATROCLUS.[280]
line: Whate’er can rest a discontented shade;

Poem Title: FUNERAL GAMES IN HONOUR OF PATROCLUS.[280]
line: But grant one last embrace, unhappy boy!

Poem Title: FUNERAL GAMES IN HONOUR OF PATROCLUS.[280]
line: Afford at least that melancholy joy.”

Poem Title: FUNERAL GAMES IN HONOUR OF PATROCLUS.[280]
FUNERAL GAMES IN HONOUR OF PATROCLUS.[280]
line: He said, and with his longing arms essay’d

Poem Title: FUNERAL GAMES IN HONOUR OF PATROCLUS.[280]
line: In vain to grasp the visionary shade!

Poem Title: FUNERAL GAMES IN HONOUR OF PATROCLUS.[280]
line: Like a thin smoke he sees the spirit fly,[284]

Poem Title: FUNERAL GAMES IN HONOUR OF PATROCLUS.[280]
line: And hears a feeble, lamentable cry.

Poem Title: FUNERAL GAMES IN HONOUR OF PATROCLUS.[280]
line: Confused he wakes; amazement breaks the bands

Poem Title: FUNERAL GAMES IN HONOUR OF PATROCLUS.[280]
line: Of golden sleep, and starting from the sands,

Poem Title: FUNERAL GAMES IN HONOUR OF PATROCLUS.[280]
line: Pensive he muses with uplifted hands:

Poem Title: FUNERAL GAMES IN HONOUR OF PATROCLUS.[280]
FUNERAL GAMES IN HONOUR OF PATROCLUS.[280]
line: “’Tis true, ’tis certain; man, though dead, retains

Poem Title: FUNERAL GAMES IN HONOUR OF PATROCLUS.[280]
line: Part of himself; the immortal mind remains:

Poem Title: FUNERAL GAMES IN HONOUR OF PATROCLUS.[280]
line: The form subsists without the body’s aid,

Poem Title: FUNERAL GAMES IN HONOUR OF PATROCLUS.[280]
line: Aerial semblance, and an empty shade!

Poem Title: FUNERAL GAMES IN HONOUR OF PATROCLUS.[280]
line: This night my friend, so late in battle lost,

Poem Title: FUNERAL GAMES IN HONOUR OF PATROCLUS.[280]
line: Stood at my side, a pensive, plaintive ghost:

Poem Title: FUNERAL GAMES IN HONOUR OF PATROCLUS.[280]
line: Even now familiar, as in life, he came;

Poem Title: FUNERAL GAMES IN HONOUR OF PATROCLUS.[280]
line: Alas! how different! yet how like the same!”

Poem Title: FUNERAL GAMES IN HONOUR OF PATROCLUS.[280]
FUNERAL GAMES IN HONOUR OF PATROCLUS.[280]
line: Thus while he spoke, each eye grew big with tears:

Poem Title: FUNERAL GAMES IN HONOUR OF PATROCLUS.[280]
line: And now the rosy-finger’d morn appears,

Poem Title: FUNERAL GAMES IN HONOUR OF PATROCLUS.[280]
line: Shows every mournful face with tears o’erspread,

Poem Title: FUNERAL GAMES IN HONOUR OF PATROCLUS.[280]
line: And glares on the pale visage of the dead.

Poem Title: FUNERAL GAMES IN HONOUR OF PATROCLUS.[280]
line: But Agamemnon, as the rites demand,

Poem Title: FUNERAL GAMES IN HONOUR OF PATROCLUS.[280]
line: With mules and waggons sends a chosen band

Poem Title: FUNERAL GAMES IN HONOUR OF PATROCLUS.[280]
line: To load the timber, and the pile to rear;

Poem Title: FUNERAL GAMES IN HONOUR OF PATROCLUS.[280]
line: A charge consign’d to Merion’s faithful care.

Poem Title: FUNERAL GAMES IN HONOUR OF PATROCLUS.[280]
line: With proper instruments they take the road,

Poem Title: FUNERAL GAMES IN HONOUR OF PATROCLUS.[280]
line: Axes to cut, and ropes to sling the load.

Poem Title: FUNERAL GAMES IN HONOUR OF PATROCLUS.[280]
line: First march the heavy mules, securely slow,

Poem Title: FUNERAL GAMES IN HONOUR OF PATROCLUS.[280]
line: O’er hills, o’er dales, o’er crags, o’er rocks they go:[285]

Poem Title: FUNERAL GAMES IN HONOUR OF PATROCLUS.[280]
line: Jumping, high o’er the shrubs of the rough ground,

Poem Title: FUNERAL GAMES IN HONOUR OF PATROCLUS.[280]
line: Rattle the clattering cars, and the shock’d axles bound.

Poem Title: FUNERAL GAMES IN HONOUR OF PATROCLUS.[280]
line: But when arrived at Ida’s spreading woods,[286]

Poem Title: FUNERAL GAMES IN HONOUR OF PATROCLUS.[280]
line: (Fair Ida, water’d with descending floods,)

Poem Title: FUNERAL GAMES IN HONOUR OF PATROCLUS.[280]
line: Loud sounds the axe, redoubling strokes on strokes;

Poem Title: FUNERAL GAMES IN HONOUR OF PATROCLUS.[280]
line: On all sides round the forest hurls her oaks

Poem Title: FUNERAL GAMES IN HONOUR OF PATROCLUS.[280]
line: Headlong. Deep echoing groan the thickets brown;

Poem Title: FUNERAL GAMES IN HONOUR OF PATROCLUS.[280]
line: Then rustling, crackling, crashing, thunder down.

Poem Title: FUNERAL GAMES IN HONOUR OF PATROCLUS.[280]
line: The wood the Grecians cleave, prepared to burn;

Poem Title: FUNERAL GAMES IN HONOUR OF PATROCLUS.[280]
line: And the slow mules the same rough road return.

Poem Title: FUNERAL GAMES IN HONOUR OF PATROCLUS.[280]
line: The sturdy woodmen equal burdens bore

Poem Title: FUNERAL GAMES IN HONOUR OF PATROCLUS.[280]
line: (Such charge was given them) to the sandy shore;

Poem Title: FUNERAL GAMES IN HONOUR OF PATROCLUS.[280]
line: There on the spot which great Achilles show’d,

Poem Title: FUNERAL GAMES IN HONOUR OF PATROCLUS.[280]
line: They eased their shoulders, and disposed the load;

Poem Title: FUNERAL GAMES IN HONOUR OF PATROCLUS.[280]
line: Circling around the place, where times to come

Poem Title: FUNERAL GAMES IN HONOUR OF PATROCLUS.[280]
line: Shall view Patroclus’ and Achilles’ tomb.

Poem Title: FUNERAL GAMES IN HONOUR OF PATROCLUS.[280]
line: The hero bids his martial troops appear

Poem Title: FUNERAL GAMES IN HONOUR OF PATROCLUS.[280]
line: High on their cars in all the pomp of war;

Poem Title: FUNERAL GAMES IN HONOUR OF PATROCLUS.[280]
line: Each in refulgent arms his limbs attires,

Poem Title: FUNERAL GAMES IN HONOUR OF PATROCLUS.[280]
line: All mount their chariots, combatants and squires.

Poem Title: FUNERAL GAMES IN HONOUR OF PATROCLUS.[280]
line: The chariots first proceed, a shining train;

Poem Title: FUNERAL GAMES IN HONOUR OF PATROCLUS.[280]
line: Then clouds of foot that smoke along the plain;

Poem Title: FUNERAL GAMES IN HONOUR OF PATROCLUS.[280]
line: Next these the melancholy band appear;

Poem Title: FUNERAL GAMES IN HONOUR OF PATROCLUS.[280]
line: Amidst, lay dead Patroclus on the bier;

Poem Title: FUNERAL GAMES IN HONOUR OF PATROCLUS.[280]
line: O’er all the corse their scattered locks they throw;

Poem Title: FUNERAL GAMES IN HONOUR OF PATROCLUS.[280]
line: Achilles next, oppress’d with mighty woe,

Poem Title: FUNERAL GAMES IN HONOUR OF PATROCLUS.[280]
line: Supporting with his hands the hero’s head,

Poem Title: FUNERAL GAMES IN HONOUR OF PATROCLUS.[280]
line: Bends o’er the extended body of the dead.

Poem Title: FUNERAL GAMES IN HONOUR OF PATROCLUS.[280]
line: Patroclus decent on the appointed ground

Poem Title: FUNERAL GAMES IN HONOUR OF PATROCLUS.[280]
line: They place, and heap the sylvan pile around.

Poem Title: FUNERAL GAMES IN HONOUR OF PATROCLUS.[280]
line: But great Achilles stands apart in prayer,

Poem Title: FUNERAL GAMES IN HONOUR OF PATROCLUS.[280]
line: And from his head divides the yellow hair;

Poem Title: FUNERAL GAMES IN HONOUR OF PATROCLUS.[280]
line: Those curling locks which from his youth he vow’d,[287]

Poem Title: FUNERAL GAMES IN HONOUR OF PATROCLUS.[280]
line: And sacred grew, to Sperchius’ honour’d flood:

Poem Title: FUNERAL GAMES IN HONOUR OF PATROCLUS.[280]
line: Then sighing, to the deep his locks he cast,

Poem Title: FUNERAL GAMES IN HONOUR OF PATROCLUS.[280]
line: And roll’d his eyes around the watery waste:

Poem Title: FUNERAL GAMES IN HONOUR OF PATROCLUS.[280]
FUNERAL GAMES IN HONOUR OF PATROCLUS.[280]
line: “Sperchius! whose waves in mazy errors lost

Poem Title: FUNERAL GAMES IN HONOUR OF PATROCLUS.[280]
line: Delightful roll along my native coast!

Poem Title: FUNERAL GAMES IN HONOUR OF PATROCLUS.[280]
line: To whom we vainly vow’d, at our return,

Poem Title: FUNERAL GAMES IN HONOUR OF PATROCLUS.[280]
line: These locks to fall, and hecatombs to burn:

Poem Title: FUNERAL GAMES IN HONOUR OF PATROCLUS.[280]
line: Full fifty rams to bleed in sacrifice,

Poem Title: FUNERAL GAMES IN HONOUR OF PATROCLUS.[280]
line: Where to the day thy silver fountains rise,

Poem Title: FUNERAL GAMES IN HONOUR OF PATROCLUS.[280]
line: And where in shade of consecrated bowers

Poem Title: FUNERAL GAMES IN HONOUR OF PATROCLUS.[280]
line: Thy altars stand, perfumed with native flowers!

Poem Title: FUNERAL GAMES IN HONOUR OF PATROCLUS.[280]
line: So vow’d my father, but he vow’d in vain;

Poem Title: FUNERAL GAMES IN HONOUR OF PATROCLUS.[280]
line: No more Achilles sees his native plain;

Poem Title: FUNERAL GAMES IN HONOUR OF PATROCLUS.[280]
line: In that vain hope these hairs no longer grow,

Poem Title: FUNERAL GAMES IN HONOUR OF PATROCLUS.[280]
line: Patroclus bears them to the shades below.”

Poem Title: FUNERAL GAMES IN HONOUR OF PATROCLUS.[280]
FUNERAL GAMES IN HONOUR OF PATROCLUS.[280]
line: Thus o’er Patroclus while the hero pray’d,

Poem Title: FUNERAL GAMES IN HONOUR OF PATROCLUS.[280]
line: On his cold hand the sacred lock he laid.

Poem Title: FUNERAL GAMES IN HONOUR OF PATROCLUS.[280]
line: Once more afresh the Grecian sorrows flow:

Poem Title: FUNERAL GAMES IN HONOUR OF PATROCLUS.[280]
line: And now the sun had set upon their woe;

Poem Title: FUNERAL GAMES IN HONOUR OF PATROCLUS.[280]
line: But to the king of men thus spoke the chief:

Poem Title: FUNERAL GAMES IN HONOUR OF PATROCLUS.[280]
line: “Enough, Atrides! give the troops relief:

Poem Title: FUNERAL GAMES IN HONOUR OF PATROCLUS.[280]
line: Permit the mourning legions to retire,

Poem Title: FUNERAL GAMES IN HONOUR OF PATROCLUS.[280]
line: And let the chiefs alone attend the pyre;

Poem Title: FUNERAL GAMES IN HONOUR OF PATROCLUS.[280]
line: The pious care be ours, the dead to burn—”

Poem Title: FUNERAL GAMES IN HONOUR OF PATROCLUS.[280]
line: He said: the people to their ships return:

Poem Title: FUNERAL GAMES IN HONOUR OF PATROCLUS.[280]
line: While those deputed to inter the slain

Poem Title: FUNERAL GAMES IN HONOUR OF PATROCLUS.[280]
line: Heap with a rising pyramid the plain.[288]

Poem Title: FUNERAL GAMES IN HONOUR OF PATROCLUS.[280]
line: A hundred foot in length, a hundred wide,

Poem Title: FUNERAL GAMES IN HONOUR OF PATROCLUS.[280]
line: The growing structure spreads on every side;

Poem Title: FUNERAL GAMES IN HONOUR OF PATROCLUS.[280]
line: High on the top the manly corse they lay,

Poem Title: FUNERAL GAMES IN HONOUR OF PATROCLUS.[280]
line: And well-fed sheep and sable oxen slay:

Poem Title: FUNERAL GAMES IN HONOUR OF PATROCLUS.[280]
line: Achilles covered with their fat the dead,

Poem Title: FUNERAL GAMES IN HONOUR OF PATROCLUS.[280]
line: And the piled victims round the body spread;

Poem Title: FUNERAL GAMES IN HONOUR OF PATROCLUS.[280]
line: Then jars of honey, and of fragrant oil,

Poem Title: FUNERAL GAMES IN HONOUR OF PATROCLUS.[280]
line: Suspends around, low-bending o’er the pile.

Poem Title: FUNERAL GAMES IN HONOUR OF PATROCLUS.[280]
line: Four sprightly coursers, with a deadly groan

Poem Title: FUNERAL GAMES IN HONOUR OF PATROCLUS.[280]
line: Pour forth their lives, and on the pyre are thrown.

Poem Title: FUNERAL GAMES IN HONOUR OF PATROCLUS.[280]
line: Of nine large dogs, domestic at his board,

Poem Title: FUNERAL GAMES IN HONOUR OF PATROCLUS.[280]
line: Fall two, selected to attend their lord,

Poem Title: FUNERAL GAMES IN HONOUR OF PATROCLUS.[280]
line: Then last of all, and horrible to tell,

Poem Title: FUNERAL GAMES IN HONOUR OF PATROCLUS.[280]
line: Sad sacrifice! twelve Trojan captives fell.[289]

Poem Title: FUNERAL GAMES IN HONOUR OF PATROCLUS.[280]
line: On these the rage of fire victorious preys,

Poem Title: FUNERAL GAMES IN HONOUR OF PATROCLUS.[280]
line: Involves and joins them in one common blaze.

Poem Title: FUNERAL GAMES IN HONOUR OF PATROCLUS.[280]
line: Smear’d with the bloody rites, he stands on high,

Poem Title: FUNERAL GAMES IN HONOUR OF PATROCLUS.[280]
line: And calls the spirit with a dreadful cry:[290]

Poem Title: FUNERAL GAMES IN HONOUR OF PATROCLUS.[280]
FUNERAL GAMES IN HONOUR OF PATROCLUS.[280]
line: “All hail, Patroclus! let thy vengeful ghost

Poem Title: FUNERAL GAMES IN HONOUR OF PATROCLUS.[280]
line: Hear, and exult, on Pluto’s dreary coast.

Poem Title: FUNERAL GAMES IN HONOUR OF PATROCLUS.[280]
line: Behold Achilles’ promise fully paid,

Poem Title: FUNERAL GAMES IN HONOUR OF PATROCLUS.[280]
line: Twelve Trojan heroes offer’d to thy shade;

Poem Title: FUNERAL GAMES IN HONOUR OF PATROCLUS.[280]
line: But heavier fates on Hector’s corse attend,

Poem Title: FUNERAL GAMES IN HONOUR OF PATROCLUS.[280]
line: Saved from the flames, for hungry dogs to rend.”

Poem Title: FUNERAL GAMES IN HONOUR OF PATROCLUS.[280]
FUNERAL GAMES IN HONOUR OF PATROCLUS.[280]
line: So spake he, threatening: but the gods made vain

Poem Title: FUNERAL GAMES IN HONOUR OF PATROCLUS.[280]
line: His threat, and guard inviolate the slain:

Poem Title: FUNERAL GAMES IN HONOUR OF PATROCLUS.[280]
line: Celestial Venus hover’d o’er his head,

Poem Title: FUNERAL GAMES IN HONOUR OF PATROCLUS.[280]
line: And roseate unguents, heavenly fragrance! shed:

Poem Title: FUNERAL GAMES IN HONOUR OF PATROCLUS.[280]
line: She watch’d him all the night and all the day,

Poem Title: FUNERAL GAMES IN HONOUR OF PATROCLUS.[280]
line: And drove the bloodhounds from their destined prey.

Poem Title: FUNERAL GAMES IN HONOUR OF PATROCLUS.[280]
line: Nor sacred Phœbus less employ’d his care;

Poem Title: FUNERAL GAMES IN HONOUR OF PATROCLUS.[280]
line: He pour’d around a veil of gather’d air,

Poem Title: FUNERAL GAMES IN HONOUR OF PATROCLUS.[280]
line: And kept the nerves undried, the flesh entire,

Poem Title: FUNERAL GAMES IN HONOUR OF PATROCLUS.[280]
line: Against the solar beam and Sirian fire.

Poem Title: FUNERAL GAMES IN HONOUR OF PATROCLUS.[280]
FUNERAL GAMES IN HONOUR OF PATROCLUS.[280]
FUNERAL GAMES IN HONOUR OF PATROCLUS.[280]
line: [Illustration: ] THE FUNERAL PILE OF PATROCLUS

Poem Title: FUNERAL GAMES IN HONOUR OF PATROCLUS.[280]
FUNERAL GAMES IN HONOUR OF PATROCLUS.[280]
FUNERAL GAMES IN HONOUR OF PATROCLUS.[280]
line: Nor yet the pile, where dead Patroclus lies,

Poem Title: FUNERAL GAMES IN HONOUR OF PATROCLUS.[280]
line: Smokes, nor as yet the sullen flames arise;

Poem Title: FUNERAL GAMES IN HONOUR OF PATROCLUS.[280]
line: But, fast beside, Achilles stood in prayer,

Poem Title: FUNERAL GAMES IN HONOUR OF PATROCLUS.[280]
line: Invoked the gods whose spirit moves the air,

Poem Title: FUNERAL GAMES IN HONOUR OF PATROCLUS.[280]
line: And victims promised, and libations cast,

Poem Title: FUNERAL GAMES IN HONOUR OF PATROCLUS.[280]
line: To gentle Zephyr and the Boreal blast:

Poem Title: FUNERAL GAMES IN HONOUR OF PATROCLUS.[280]
line: He call’d the aerial powers, along the skies

Poem Title: FUNERAL GAMES IN HONOUR OF PATROCLUS.[280]
line: To breathe, and whisper to the fires to rise.

Poem Title: FUNERAL GAMES IN HONOUR OF PATROCLUS.[280]
line: The winged Iris heard the hero’s call,

Poem Title: FUNERAL GAMES IN HONOUR OF PATROCLUS.[280]
line: And instant hasten’d to their airy hall,

Poem Title: FUNERAL GAMES IN HONOUR OF PATROCLUS.[280]
line: Where in old Zephyr’s open courts on high,

Poem Title: FUNERAL GAMES IN HONOUR OF PATROCLUS.[280]
line: Sat all the blustering brethren of the sky.

Poem Title: FUNERAL GAMES IN HONOUR OF PATROCLUS.[280]
line: She shone amidst them, on her painted bow;

Poem Title: FUNERAL GAMES IN HONOUR OF PATROCLUS.[280]
line: The rocky pavement glitter’d with the show.

Poem Title: FUNERAL GAMES IN HONOUR OF PATROCLUS.[280]
line: All from the banquet rise, and each invites

Poem Title: FUNERAL GAMES IN HONOUR OF PATROCLUS.[280]
line: The various goddess to partake the rites.

Poem Title: FUNERAL GAMES IN HONOUR OF PATROCLUS.[280]
line: “Not so (the dame replied), I haste to go

Poem Title: FUNERAL GAMES IN HONOUR OF PATROCLUS.[280]
line: To sacred Ocean, and the floods below:

Poem Title: FUNERAL GAMES IN HONOUR OF PATROCLUS.[280]
line: Even now our solemn hecatombs attend,

Poem Title: FUNERAL GAMES IN HONOUR OF PATROCLUS.[280]
line: And heaven is feasting on the world’s green end

Poem Title: FUNERAL GAMES IN HONOUR OF PATROCLUS.[280]
line: With righteous Ethiops (uncorrupted train!)

Poem Title: FUNERAL GAMES IN HONOUR OF PATROCLUS.[280]
line: Far on the extremest limits of the main.

Poem Title: FUNERAL GAMES IN HONOUR OF PATROCLUS.[280]
line: But Peleus’ son entreats, with sacrifice,

Poem Title: FUNERAL GAMES IN HONOUR OF PATROCLUS.[280]
line: The western spirit, and the north, to rise!

Poem Title: FUNERAL GAMES IN HONOUR OF PATROCLUS.[280]
line: Let on Patroclus’ pile your blast be driven,

Poem Title: FUNERAL GAMES IN HONOUR OF PATROCLUS.[280]
line: And bear the blazing honours high to heaven.”

Poem Title: FUNERAL GAMES IN HONOUR OF PATROCLUS.[280]
FUNERAL GAMES IN HONOUR OF PATROCLUS.[280]
line: Swift as the word she vanish’d from their view;

Poem Title: FUNERAL GAMES IN HONOUR OF PATROCLUS.[280]
line: Swift as the word the winds tumultuous flew;

Poem Title: FUNERAL GAMES IN HONOUR OF PATROCLUS.[280]
line: Forth burst the stormy band with thundering roar,

Poem Title: FUNERAL GAMES IN HONOUR OF PATROCLUS.[280]
line: And heaps on heaps the clouds are toss’d before.

Poem Title: FUNERAL GAMES IN HONOUR OF PATROCLUS.[280]
line: To the wide main then stooping from the skies,

Poem Title: FUNERAL GAMES IN HONOUR OF PATROCLUS.[280]
line: The heaving deeps in watery mountains rise:

Poem Title: FUNERAL GAMES IN HONOUR OF PATROCLUS.[280]
line: Troy feels the blast along her shaking walls,

Poem Title: FUNERAL GAMES IN HONOUR OF PATROCLUS.[280]
line: Till on the pile the gather’d tempest falls.

Poem Title: FUNERAL GAMES IN HONOUR OF PATROCLUS.[280]
line: The structure crackles in the roaring fires,

Poem Title: FUNERAL GAMES IN HONOUR OF PATROCLUS.[280]
line: And all the night the plenteous flame aspires.

Poem Title: FUNERAL GAMES IN HONOUR OF PATROCLUS.[280]
line: All night Achilles hails Patroclus’ soul,

Poem Title: FUNERAL GAMES IN HONOUR OF PATROCLUS.[280]
line: With large libations from the golden bowl.

Poem Title: FUNERAL GAMES IN HONOUR OF PATROCLUS.[280]
line: As a poor father, helpless and undone,

Poem Title: FUNERAL GAMES IN HONOUR OF PATROCLUS.[280]
line: Mourns o’er the ashes of an only son,

Poem Title: FUNERAL GAMES IN HONOUR OF PATROCLUS.[280]
line: Takes a sad pleasure the last bones to burn,

Poem Title: FUNERAL GAMES IN HONOUR OF PATROCLUS.[280]
line: And pours in tears, ere yet they close the urn:

Poem Title: FUNERAL GAMES IN HONOUR OF PATROCLUS.[280]
line: So stay’d Achilles, circling round the shore,

Poem Title: FUNERAL GAMES IN HONOUR OF PATROCLUS.[280]
line: So watch’d the flames, till now they flame no more.

Poem Title: FUNERAL GAMES IN HONOUR OF PATROCLUS.[280]
line: ’Twas when, emerging through the shades of night,

Poem Title: FUNERAL GAMES IN HONOUR OF PATROCLUS.[280]
line: The morning planet told the approach of light;

Poem Title: FUNERAL GAMES IN HONOUR OF PATROCLUS.[280]
line: And, fast behind, Aurora’s warmer ray

Poem Title: FUNERAL GAMES IN HONOUR OF PATROCLUS.[280]
line: O’er the broad ocean pour’d the golden day:

Poem Title: FUNERAL GAMES IN HONOUR OF PATROCLUS.[280]
line: Then sank the blaze, the pile no longer burn’d,

Poem Title: FUNERAL GAMES IN HONOUR OF PATROCLUS.[280]
line: And to their caves the whistling winds return’d:

Poem Title: FUNERAL GAMES IN HONOUR OF PATROCLUS.[280]
line: Across the Thracian seas their course they bore;

Poem Title: FUNERAL GAMES IN HONOUR OF PATROCLUS.[280]
line: The ruffled seas beneath their passage roar.

Poem Title: FUNERAL GAMES IN HONOUR OF PATROCLUS.[280]
FUNERAL GAMES IN HONOUR OF PATROCLUS.[280]
line: Then parting from the pile he ceased to weep,

Poem Title: FUNERAL GAMES IN HONOUR OF PATROCLUS.[280]
line: And sank to quiet in the embrace of sleep,

Poem Title: FUNERAL GAMES IN HONOUR OF PATROCLUS.[280]
line: Exhausted with his grief: meanwhile the crowd

Poem Title: FUNERAL GAMES IN HONOUR OF PATROCLUS.[280]
line: Of thronging Grecians round Achilles stood;

Poem Title: FUNERAL GAMES IN HONOUR OF PATROCLUS.[280]
line: The tumult waked him: from his eyes he shook

Poem Title: FUNERAL GAMES IN HONOUR OF PATROCLUS.[280]
line: Unwilling slumber, and the chiefs bespoke:

Poem Title: FUNERAL GAMES IN HONOUR OF PATROCLUS.[280]
FUNERAL GAMES IN HONOUR OF PATROCLUS.[280]
line: “Ye kings and princes of the Achaian name!

Poem Title: FUNERAL GAMES IN HONOUR OF PATROCLUS.[280]
line: First let us quench the yet remaining flame

Poem Title: FUNERAL GAMES IN HONOUR OF PATROCLUS.[280]
line: With sable wine; then, as the rites direct,

Poem Title: FUNERAL GAMES IN HONOUR OF PATROCLUS.[280]
line: The hero’s bones with careful view select:

Poem Title: FUNERAL GAMES IN HONOUR OF PATROCLUS.[280]
line: (Apart, and easy to be known they lie

Poem Title: FUNERAL GAMES IN HONOUR OF PATROCLUS.[280]
line: Amidst the heap, and obvious to the eye:

Poem Title: FUNERAL GAMES IN HONOUR OF PATROCLUS.[280]
line: The rest around the margin will be seen

Poem Title: FUNERAL GAMES IN HONOUR OF PATROCLUS.[280]
line: Promiscuous, steeds and immolated men:)

Poem Title: FUNERAL GAMES IN HONOUR OF PATROCLUS.[280]
line: These wrapp’d in double cauls of fat, prepare;

Poem Title: FUNERAL GAMES IN HONOUR OF PATROCLUS.[280]
line: And in the golden vase dispose with care;

Poem Title: FUNERAL GAMES IN HONOUR OF PATROCLUS.[280]
line: There let them rest with decent honour laid,

Poem Title: FUNERAL GAMES IN HONOUR OF PATROCLUS.[280]
line: Till I shall follow to the infernal shade.

Poem Title: FUNERAL GAMES IN HONOUR OF PATROCLUS.[280]
line: Meantime erect the tomb with pious hands,

Poem Title: FUNERAL GAMES IN HONOUR OF PATROCLUS.[280]
line: A common structure on the humble sands:

Poem Title: FUNERAL GAMES IN HONOUR OF PATROCLUS.[280]
line: Hereafter Greece some nobler work may raise,

Poem Title: FUNERAL GAMES IN HONOUR OF PATROCLUS.[280]
line: And late posterity record our praise!”

Poem Title: FUNERAL GAMES IN HONOUR OF PATROCLUS.[280]
FUNERAL GAMES IN HONOUR OF PATROCLUS.[280]
line: The Greeks obey; where yet the embers glow,

Poem Title: FUNERAL GAMES IN HONOUR OF PATROCLUS.[280]
line: Wide o’er the pile the sable wine they throw,

Poem Title: FUNERAL GAMES IN HONOUR OF PATROCLUS.[280]
line: And deep subsides the ashy heap below.

Poem Title: FUNERAL GAMES IN HONOUR OF PATROCLUS.[280]
line: Next the white bones his sad companions place,

Poem Title: FUNERAL GAMES IN HONOUR OF PATROCLUS.[280]
line: With tears collected, in the golden vase.

Poem Title: FUNERAL GAMES IN HONOUR OF PATROCLUS.[280]
line: The sacred relics to the tent they bore;

Poem Title: FUNERAL GAMES IN HONOUR OF PATROCLUS.[280]
line: The urn a veil of linen covered o’er.

Poem Title: FUNERAL GAMES IN HONOUR OF PATROCLUS.[280]
line: That done, they bid the sepulchre aspire,

Poem Title: FUNERAL GAMES IN HONOUR OF PATROCLUS.[280]
line: And cast the deep foundations round the pyre;

Poem Title: FUNERAL GAMES IN HONOUR OF PATROCLUS.[280]
line: High in the midst they heap the swelling bed

Poem Title: FUNERAL GAMES IN HONOUR OF PATROCLUS.[280]
line: Of rising earth, memorial of the dead.

Poem Title: FUNERAL GAMES IN HONOUR OF PATROCLUS.[280]
FUNERAL GAMES IN HONOUR OF PATROCLUS.[280]
line: The swarming populace the chief detains,

Poem Title: FUNERAL GAMES IN HONOUR OF PATROCLUS.[280]
line: And leads amidst a wide extent of plains;

Poem Title: FUNERAL GAMES IN HONOUR OF PATROCLUS.[280]
line: There placed them round: then from the ships proceeds

Poem Title: FUNERAL GAMES IN HONOUR OF PATROCLUS.[280]
line: A train of oxen, mules, and stately steeds,

Poem Title: FUNERAL GAMES IN HONOUR OF PATROCLUS.[280]
line: Vases and tripods (for the funeral games),

Poem Title: FUNERAL GAMES IN HONOUR OF PATROCLUS.[280]
line: Resplendent brass, and more resplendent dames.

Poem Title: FUNERAL GAMES IN HONOUR OF PATROCLUS.[280]
line: First stood the prizes to reward the force

Poem Title: FUNERAL GAMES IN HONOUR OF PATROCLUS.[280]
line: Of rapid racers in the dusty course:

Poem Title: FUNERAL GAMES IN HONOUR OF PATROCLUS.[280]
line: A woman for the first, in beauty’s bloom,

Poem Title: FUNERAL GAMES IN HONOUR OF PATROCLUS.[280]
line: Skill’d in the needle, and the labouring loom;

Poem Title: FUNERAL GAMES IN HONOUR OF PATROCLUS.[280]
line: And a large vase, where two bright handles rise,

Poem Title: FUNERAL GAMES IN HONOUR OF PATROCLUS.[280]
line: Of twenty measures its capacious size.

Poem Title: FUNERAL GAMES IN HONOUR OF PATROCLUS.[280]
line: The second victor claims a mare unbroke,

Poem Title: FUNERAL GAMES IN HONOUR OF PATROCLUS.[280]
line: Big with a mule, unknowing of the yoke:

Poem Title: FUNERAL GAMES IN HONOUR OF PATROCLUS.[280]
line: The third, a charger yet untouch’d by flame;

Poem Title: FUNERAL GAMES IN HONOUR OF PATROCLUS.[280]
line: Four ample measures held the shining frame:

Poem Title: FUNERAL GAMES IN HONOUR OF PATROCLUS.[280]
line: Two golden talents for the fourth were placed:

Poem Title: FUNERAL GAMES IN HONOUR OF PATROCLUS.[280]
line: An ample double bowl contents the last.

Poem Title: FUNERAL GAMES IN HONOUR OF PATROCLUS.[280]
line: These in fair order ranged upon the plain,

Poem Title: FUNERAL GAMES IN HONOUR OF PATROCLUS.[280]
line: The hero, rising, thus address’d the train:

Poem Title: FUNERAL GAMES IN HONOUR OF PATROCLUS.[280]
FUNERAL GAMES IN HONOUR OF PATROCLUS.[280]
line: “Behold the prizes, valiant Greeks! decreed

Poem Title: FUNERAL GAMES IN HONOUR OF PATROCLUS.[280]
line: To the brave rulers of the racing steed;

Poem Title: FUNERAL GAMES IN HONOUR OF PATROCLUS.[280]
line: Prizes which none beside ourself could gain,

Poem Title: FUNERAL GAMES IN HONOUR OF PATROCLUS.[280]
line: Should our immortal coursers take the plain;

Poem Title: FUNERAL GAMES IN HONOUR OF PATROCLUS.[280]
line: (A race unrivall’d, which from ocean’s god

Poem Title: FUNERAL GAMES IN HONOUR OF PATROCLUS.[280]
line: Peleus received, and on his son bestow’d.)

Poem Title: FUNERAL GAMES IN HONOUR OF PATROCLUS.[280]
line: But this no time our vigour to display;

Poem Title: FUNERAL GAMES IN HONOUR OF PATROCLUS.[280]
line: Nor suit, with them, the games of this sad day:

Poem Title: FUNERAL GAMES IN HONOUR OF PATROCLUS.[280]
line: Lost is Patroclus now, that wont to deck

Poem Title: FUNERAL GAMES IN HONOUR OF PATROCLUS.[280]
line: Their flowing manes, and sleek their glossy neck.

Poem Title: FUNERAL GAMES IN HONOUR OF PATROCLUS.[280]
line: Sad, as they shared in human grief, they stand,

Poem Title: FUNERAL GAMES IN HONOUR OF PATROCLUS.[280]
line: And trail those graceful honours on the sand!

Poem Title: FUNERAL GAMES IN HONOUR OF PATROCLUS.[280]
line: Let others for the noble task prepare,

Poem Title: FUNERAL GAMES IN HONOUR OF PATROCLUS.[280]
line: Who trust the courser and the flying car.”

Poem Title: FUNERAL GAMES IN HONOUR OF PATROCLUS.[280]
FUNERAL GAMES IN HONOUR OF PATROCLUS.[280]
line: Fired at his word the rival racers rise;

Poem Title: FUNERAL GAMES IN HONOUR OF PATROCLUS.[280]
line: But far the first Eumelus hopes the prize,

Poem Title: FUNERAL GAMES IN HONOUR OF PATROCLUS.[280]
line: Famed though Pieria for the fleetest breed,

Poem Title: FUNERAL GAMES IN HONOUR OF PATROCLUS.[280]
line: And skill’d to manage the high-bounding steed.

Poem Title: FUNERAL GAMES IN HONOUR OF PATROCLUS.[280]
line: With equal ardour bold Tydides swell’d,

Poem Title: FUNERAL GAMES IN HONOUR OF PATROCLUS.[280]
line: The steeds of Tros beneath his yoke compell’d

Poem Title: FUNERAL GAMES IN HONOUR OF PATROCLUS.[280]
line: (Which late obey’d the Dardan chief’s command,

Poem Title: FUNERAL GAMES IN HONOUR OF PATROCLUS.[280]
line: When scarce a god redeem’d him from his hand).

Poem Title: FUNERAL GAMES IN HONOUR OF PATROCLUS.[280]
line: Then Menelaus his Podargus brings,

Poem Title: FUNERAL GAMES IN HONOUR OF PATROCLUS.[280]
line: And the famed courser of the king of kings:

Poem Title: FUNERAL GAMES IN HONOUR OF PATROCLUS.[280]
line: Whom rich Echepolus (more rich than brave),

Poem Title: FUNERAL GAMES IN HONOUR OF PATROCLUS.[280]
line: To ’scape the wars, to Agamemnon gave,

Poem Title: FUNERAL GAMES IN HONOUR OF PATROCLUS.[280]
line: (Æthe her name) at home to end his days;

Poem Title: FUNERAL GAMES IN HONOUR OF PATROCLUS.[280]
line: Base wealth preferring to eternal praise.

Poem Title: FUNERAL GAMES IN HONOUR OF PATROCLUS.[280]
line: Next him Antilochus demands the course

Poem Title: FUNERAL GAMES IN HONOUR OF PATROCLUS.[280]
line: With beating heart, and cheers his Pylian horse.

Poem Title: FUNERAL GAMES IN HONOUR OF PATROCLUS.[280]
line: Experienced Nestor gives his son the reins,

Poem Title: FUNERAL GAMES IN HONOUR OF PATROCLUS.[280]
line: Directs his judgment, and his heat restrains;

Poem Title: FUNERAL GAMES IN HONOUR OF PATROCLUS.[280]
line: Nor idly warns the hoary sire, nor hears

Poem Title: FUNERAL GAMES IN HONOUR OF PATROCLUS.[280]
line: The prudent son with unattending ears.

Poem Title: FUNERAL GAMES IN HONOUR OF PATROCLUS.[280]
FUNERAL GAMES IN HONOUR OF PATROCLUS.[280]
line: “My son! though youthful ardour fire thy breast,

Poem Title: FUNERAL GAMES IN HONOUR OF PATROCLUS.[280]
line: The gods have loved thee, and with arts have bless’d;

Poem Title: FUNERAL GAMES IN HONOUR OF PATROCLUS.[280]
line: Neptune and Jove on thee conferr’d the skill

Poem Title: FUNERAL GAMES IN HONOUR OF PATROCLUS.[280]
line: Swift round the goal to turn the flying wheel.

Poem Title: FUNERAL GAMES IN HONOUR OF PATROCLUS.[280]
line: To guide thy conduct little precept needs;

Poem Title: FUNERAL GAMES IN HONOUR OF PATROCLUS.[280]
line: But slow, and past their vigour, are my steeds.

Poem Title: FUNERAL GAMES IN HONOUR OF PATROCLUS.[280]
line: Fear not thy rivals, though for swiftness known;

Poem Title: FUNERAL GAMES IN HONOUR OF PATROCLUS.[280]
line: Compare those rivals’ judgment and thy own:

Poem Title: FUNERAL GAMES IN HONOUR OF PATROCLUS.[280]
line: It is not strength, but art, obtains the prize,

Poem Title: FUNERAL GAMES IN HONOUR OF PATROCLUS.[280]
line: And to be swift is less than to be wise.

Poem Title: FUNERAL GAMES IN HONOUR OF PATROCLUS.[280]
line: ’Tis more by art than force of numerous strokes

Poem Title: FUNERAL GAMES IN HONOUR OF PATROCLUS.[280]
line: The dexterous woodman shapes the stubborn oaks;

Poem Title: FUNERAL GAMES IN HONOUR OF PATROCLUS.[280]
line: By art the pilot, through the boiling deep

Poem Title: FUNERAL GAMES IN HONOUR OF PATROCLUS.[280]
line: And howling tempest, steers the fearless ship;

Poem Title: FUNERAL GAMES IN HONOUR OF PATROCLUS.[280]
line: And ’tis the artist wins the glorious course;

Poem Title: FUNERAL GAMES IN HONOUR OF PATROCLUS.[280]
line: Not those who trust in chariots and in horse.

Poem Title: FUNERAL GAMES IN HONOUR OF PATROCLUS.[280]
line: In vain, unskilful to the goal they strive,

Poem Title: FUNERAL GAMES IN HONOUR OF PATROCLUS.[280]
line: And short, or wide, the ungovern’d courser drive:

Poem Title: FUNERAL GAMES IN HONOUR OF PATROCLUS.[280]
line: While with sure skill, though with inferior steeds,

Poem Title: FUNERAL GAMES IN HONOUR OF PATROCLUS.[280]
line: The knowing racer to his end proceeds;

Poem Title: FUNERAL GAMES IN HONOUR OF PATROCLUS.[280]
line: Fix’d on the goal his eye foreruns the course,

Poem Title: FUNERAL GAMES IN HONOUR OF PATROCLUS.[280]
line: His hand unerring steers the steady horse,

Poem Title: FUNERAL GAMES IN HONOUR OF PATROCLUS.[280]
line: And now contracts, or now extends the rein,

Poem Title: FUNERAL GAMES IN HONOUR OF PATROCLUS.[280]
line: Observing still the foremost on the plain.

Poem Title: FUNERAL GAMES IN HONOUR OF PATROCLUS.[280]
line: Mark then the goal, ’tis easy to be found;

Poem Title: FUNERAL GAMES IN HONOUR OF PATROCLUS.[280]
line: Yon aged trunk, a cubit from the ground;

Poem Title: FUNERAL GAMES IN HONOUR OF PATROCLUS.[280]
line: Of some once stately oak the last remains,

Poem Title: FUNERAL GAMES IN HONOUR OF PATROCLUS.[280]
line: Or hardy fir, unperish’d with the rains:

Poem Title: FUNERAL GAMES IN HONOUR OF PATROCLUS.[280]
line: Inclosed with stones, conspicuous from afar;

Poem Title: FUNERAL GAMES IN HONOUR OF PATROCLUS.[280]
line: And round, a circle for the wheeling car.

Poem Title: FUNERAL GAMES IN HONOUR OF PATROCLUS.[280]
line: (Some tomb perhaps of old, the dead to grace;

Poem Title: FUNERAL GAMES IN HONOUR OF PATROCLUS.[280]
line: Or then, as now, the limit of a race.)

Poem Title: FUNERAL GAMES IN HONOUR OF PATROCLUS.[280]
line: Bear close to this, and warily proceed,

Poem Title: FUNERAL GAMES IN HONOUR OF PATROCLUS.[280]
line: A little bending to the left-hand steed;

Poem Title: FUNERAL GAMES IN HONOUR OF PATROCLUS.[280]
line: But urge the right, and give him all the reins;

Poem Title: FUNERAL GAMES IN HONOUR OF PATROCLUS.[280]
line: While thy strict hand his fellow’s head restrains,

Poem Title: FUNERAL GAMES IN HONOUR OF PATROCLUS.[280]
line: And turns him short; till, doubling as they roll,

Poem Title: FUNERAL GAMES IN HONOUR OF PATROCLUS.[280]
line: The wheel’s round naves appear to brush the goal.

Poem Title: FUNERAL GAMES IN HONOUR OF PATROCLUS.[280]
line: Yet (not to break the car, or lame the horse)

Poem Title: FUNERAL GAMES IN HONOUR OF PATROCLUS.[280]
line: Clear of the stony heap direct the course;

Poem Title: FUNERAL GAMES IN HONOUR OF PATROCLUS.[280]
line: Lest through incaution failing, thou mayst be

Poem Title: FUNERAL GAMES IN HONOUR OF PATROCLUS.[280]
line: A joy to others, a reproach to me.

Poem Title: FUNERAL GAMES IN HONOUR OF PATROCLUS.[280]
line: So shalt thou pass the goal, secure of mind,

Poem Title: FUNERAL GAMES IN HONOUR OF PATROCLUS.[280]
line: And leave unskilful swiftness far behind:

Poem Title: FUNERAL GAMES IN HONOUR OF PATROCLUS.[280]
line: Though thy fierce rival drove the matchless steed

Poem Title: FUNERAL GAMES IN HONOUR OF PATROCLUS.[280]
line: Which bore Adrastus, of celestial breed;

Poem Title: FUNERAL GAMES IN HONOUR OF PATROCLUS.[280]
line: Or the famed race, through all the regions known,

Poem Title: FUNERAL GAMES IN HONOUR OF PATROCLUS.[280]
line: That whirl’d the car of proud Laomedon.”

Poem Title: FUNERAL GAMES IN HONOUR OF PATROCLUS.[280]
FUNERAL GAMES IN HONOUR OF PATROCLUS.[280]
line: Thus (nought unsaid) the much-advising sage

Poem Title: FUNERAL GAMES IN HONOUR OF PATROCLUS.[280]
line: Concludes; then sat, stiff with unwieldy age.

Poem Title: FUNERAL GAMES IN HONOUR OF PATROCLUS.[280]
line: Next bold Meriones was seen to rise,

Poem Title: FUNERAL GAMES IN HONOUR OF PATROCLUS.[280]
line: The last, but not least ardent for the prize.

Poem Title: FUNERAL GAMES IN HONOUR OF PATROCLUS.[280]
line: They mount their seats; the lots their place dispose

Poem Title: FUNERAL GAMES IN HONOUR OF PATROCLUS.[280]
line: (Roll’d in his helmet, these Achilles throws).

Poem Title: FUNERAL GAMES IN HONOUR OF PATROCLUS.[280]
line: Young Nestor leads the race: Eumelus then;

Poem Title: FUNERAL GAMES IN HONOUR OF PATROCLUS.[280]
line: And next the brother of the king of men:

Poem Title: FUNERAL GAMES IN HONOUR OF PATROCLUS.[280]
line: Thy lot, Meriones, the fourth was cast;

Poem Title: FUNERAL GAMES IN HONOUR OF PATROCLUS.[280]
line: And, far the bravest, Diomed, was last.

Poem Title: FUNERAL GAMES IN HONOUR OF PATROCLUS.[280]
line: They stand in order, an impatient train:

Poem Title: FUNERAL GAMES IN HONOUR OF PATROCLUS.[280]
line: Pelides points the barrier on the plain,

Poem Title: FUNERAL GAMES IN HONOUR OF PATROCLUS.[280]
line: And sends before old Phœnix to the place,

Poem Title: FUNERAL GAMES IN HONOUR OF PATROCLUS.[280]
line: To mark the racers, and to judge the race.

Poem Title: FUNERAL GAMES IN HONOUR OF PATROCLUS.[280]
line: At once the coursers from the barrier bound;

Poem Title: FUNERAL GAMES IN HONOUR OF PATROCLUS.[280]
line: The lifted scourges all at once resound;

Poem Title: FUNERAL GAMES IN HONOUR OF PATROCLUS.[280]
line: Their heart, their eyes, their voice, they send before;

Poem Title: FUNERAL GAMES IN HONOUR OF PATROCLUS.[280]
line: And up the champaign thunder from the shore:

Poem Title: FUNERAL GAMES IN HONOUR OF PATROCLUS.[280]
line: Thick, where they drive, the dusty clouds arise,

Poem Title: FUNERAL GAMES IN HONOUR OF PATROCLUS.[280]
line: And the lost courser in the whirlwind flies;

Poem Title: FUNERAL GAMES IN HONOUR OF PATROCLUS.[280]
line: Loose on their shoulders the long manes reclined,

Poem Title: FUNERAL GAMES IN HONOUR OF PATROCLUS.[280]
line: Float in their speed, and dance upon the wind:

Poem Title: FUNERAL GAMES IN HONOUR OF PATROCLUS.[280]
line: The smoking chariots, rapid as they bound,

Poem Title: FUNERAL GAMES IN HONOUR OF PATROCLUS.[280]
line: Now seem to touch the sky, and now the ground.

Poem Title: FUNERAL GAMES IN HONOUR OF PATROCLUS.[280]
line: While hot for fame, and conquest all their care,

Poem Title: FUNERAL GAMES IN HONOUR OF PATROCLUS.[280]
line: (Each o’er his flying courser hung in air,)

Poem Title: FUNERAL GAMES IN HONOUR OF PATROCLUS.[280]
line: Erect with ardour, poised upon the rein,

Poem Title: FUNERAL GAMES IN HONOUR OF PATROCLUS.[280]
line: They pant, they stretch, they shout along the plain.

Poem Title: FUNERAL GAMES IN HONOUR OF PATROCLUS.[280]
line: Now (the last compass fetch’d around the goal)

Poem Title: FUNERAL GAMES IN HONOUR OF PATROCLUS.[280]
line: At the near prize each gathers all his soul,

Poem Title: FUNERAL GAMES IN HONOUR OF PATROCLUS.[280]
line: Each burns with double hope, with double pain,

Poem Title: FUNERAL GAMES IN HONOUR OF PATROCLUS.[280]
line: Tears up the shore, and thunders toward the main.

Poem Title: FUNERAL GAMES IN HONOUR OF PATROCLUS.[280]
line: First flew Eumelus on Pheretian steeds;

Poem Title: FUNERAL GAMES IN HONOUR OF PATROCLUS.[280]
line: With those of Tros bold Diomed succeeds:

Poem Title: FUNERAL GAMES IN HONOUR OF PATROCLUS.[280]
line: Close on Eumelus’ back they puff the wind,

Poem Title: FUNERAL GAMES IN HONOUR OF PATROCLUS.[280]
line: And seem just mounting on his car behind;

Poem Title: FUNERAL GAMES IN HONOUR OF PATROCLUS.[280]
line: Full on his neck he feels the sultry breeze,

Poem Title: FUNERAL GAMES IN HONOUR OF PATROCLUS.[280]
line: And, hovering o’er, their stretching shadows sees.

Poem Title: FUNERAL GAMES IN HONOUR OF PATROCLUS.[280]
line: Then had he lost, or left a doubtful prize;

Poem Title: FUNERAL GAMES IN HONOUR OF PATROCLUS.[280]
line: But angry Phœbus to Tydides flies,

Poem Title: FUNERAL GAMES IN HONOUR OF PATROCLUS.[280]
line: Strikes from his hand the scourge, and renders vain

Poem Title: FUNERAL GAMES IN HONOUR OF PATROCLUS.[280]
line: His matchless horses’ labour on the plain.

Poem Title: FUNERAL GAMES IN HONOUR OF PATROCLUS.[280]
line: Rage fills his eye with anguish, to survey

Poem Title: FUNERAL GAMES IN HONOUR OF PATROCLUS.[280]
line: Snatch’d from his hope the glories of the day.

Poem Title: FUNERAL GAMES IN HONOUR OF PATROCLUS.[280]
line: The fraud celestial Pallas sees with pain,

Poem Title: FUNERAL GAMES IN HONOUR OF PATROCLUS.[280]
line: Springs to her knight, and gives the scourge again,

Poem Title: FUNERAL GAMES IN HONOUR OF PATROCLUS.[280]
line: And fills his steeds with vigour. At a stroke

Poem Title: FUNERAL GAMES IN HONOUR OF PATROCLUS.[280]
line: She breaks his rival’s chariot from the yoke:

Poem Title: FUNERAL GAMES IN HONOUR OF PATROCLUS.[280]
line: No more their way the startled horses held;

Poem Title: FUNERAL GAMES IN HONOUR OF PATROCLUS.[280]
line: The car reversed came rattling on the field;

Poem Title: FUNERAL GAMES IN HONOUR OF PATROCLUS.[280]
line: Shot headlong from his seat, beside the wheel,

Poem Title: FUNERAL GAMES IN HONOUR OF PATROCLUS.[280]
line: Prone on the dust the unhappy master fell;

Poem Title: FUNERAL GAMES IN HONOUR OF PATROCLUS.[280]
line: His batter’d face and elbows strike the ground;

Poem Title: FUNERAL GAMES IN HONOUR OF PATROCLUS.[280]
line: Nose, mouth, and front, one undistinguish’d wound:

Poem Title: FUNERAL GAMES IN HONOUR OF PATROCLUS.[280]
line: Grief stops his voice, a torrent drowns his eyes:

Poem Title: FUNERAL GAMES IN HONOUR OF PATROCLUS.[280]
line: Before him far the glad Tydides flies;

Poem Title: FUNERAL GAMES IN HONOUR OF PATROCLUS.[280]
line: Minerva’s spirit drives his matchless pace,

Poem Title: FUNERAL GAMES IN HONOUR OF PATROCLUS.[280]
line: And crowns him victor of the labour’d race.

Poem Title: FUNERAL GAMES IN HONOUR OF PATROCLUS.[280]
FUNERAL GAMES IN HONOUR OF PATROCLUS.[280]
line: The next, though distant, Menelaus succeeds;

Poem Title: FUNERAL GAMES IN HONOUR OF PATROCLUS.[280]
line: While thus young Nestor animates his steeds:

Poem Title: FUNERAL GAMES IN HONOUR OF PATROCLUS.[280]
line: “Now, now, my generous pair, exert your force;

Poem Title: FUNERAL GAMES IN HONOUR OF PATROCLUS.[280]
line: Not that we hope to match Tydides’ horse,

Poem Title: FUNERAL GAMES IN HONOUR OF PATROCLUS.[280]
line: Since great Minerva wings their rapid way,

Poem Title: FUNERAL GAMES IN HONOUR OF PATROCLUS.[280]
line: And gives their lord the honours of the day;

Poem Title: FUNERAL GAMES IN HONOUR OF PATROCLUS.[280]
line: But reach Atrides! shall his mare outgo

Poem Title: FUNERAL GAMES IN HONOUR OF PATROCLUS.[280]
line: Your swiftness? vanquish’d by a female foe?

Poem Title: FUNERAL GAMES IN HONOUR OF PATROCLUS.[280]
line: Through your neglect, if lagging on the plain

Poem Title: FUNERAL GAMES IN HONOUR OF PATROCLUS.[280]
line: The last ignoble gift be all we gain,

Poem Title: FUNERAL GAMES IN HONOUR OF PATROCLUS.[280]
line: No more shall Nestor’s hand your food supply,

Poem Title: FUNERAL GAMES IN HONOUR OF PATROCLUS.[280]
line: The old man’s fury rises, and ye die.

Poem Title: FUNERAL GAMES IN HONOUR OF PATROCLUS.[280]
line: Haste then: yon narrow road, before our sight,

Poem Title: FUNERAL GAMES IN HONOUR OF PATROCLUS.[280]
line: Presents the occasion, could we use it right.”

Poem Title: FUNERAL GAMES IN HONOUR OF PATROCLUS.[280]
FUNERAL GAMES IN HONOUR OF PATROCLUS.[280]
line: Thus he. The coursers at their master’s threat

Poem Title: FUNERAL GAMES IN HONOUR OF PATROCLUS.[280]
line: With quicker steps the sounding champaign beat.

Poem Title: FUNERAL GAMES IN HONOUR OF PATROCLUS.[280]
line: And now Antilochus with nice survey

Poem Title: FUNERAL GAMES IN HONOUR OF PATROCLUS.[280]
line: Observes the compass of the hollow way.

Poem Title: FUNERAL GAMES IN HONOUR OF PATROCLUS.[280]
line: ’Twas where, by force of wintry torrents torn,

Poem Title: FUNERAL GAMES IN HONOUR OF PATROCLUS.[280]
line: Fast by the road a precipice was worn:

Poem Title: FUNERAL GAMES IN HONOUR OF PATROCLUS.[280]
line: Here, where but one could pass, to shun the throng

Poem Title: FUNERAL GAMES IN HONOUR OF PATROCLUS.[280]
line: The Spartan hero’s chariot smoked along.

Poem Title: FUNERAL GAMES IN HONOUR OF PATROCLUS.[280]
line: Close up the venturous youth resolves to keep,

Poem Title: FUNERAL GAMES IN HONOUR OF PATROCLUS.[280]
line: Still edging near, and bears him toward the steep.

Poem Title: FUNERAL GAMES IN HONOUR OF PATROCLUS.[280]
line: Atrides, trembling, casts his eye below,

Poem Title: FUNERAL GAMES IN HONOUR OF PATROCLUS.[280]
line: And wonders at the rashness of his foe.

Poem Title: FUNERAL GAMES IN HONOUR OF PATROCLUS.[280]
line: “Hold, stay your steeds—What madness thus to ride

Poem Title: FUNERAL GAMES IN HONOUR OF PATROCLUS.[280]
line: This narrow way! take larger field (he cried),

Poem Title: FUNERAL GAMES IN HONOUR OF PATROCLUS.[280]
line: Or both must fall.”—Atrides cried in vain;

Poem Title: FUNERAL GAMES IN HONOUR OF PATROCLUS.[280]
line: He flies more fast, and throws up all the rein.

Poem Title: FUNERAL GAMES IN HONOUR OF PATROCLUS.[280]
line: Far as an able arm the disk can send,

Poem Title: FUNERAL GAMES IN HONOUR OF PATROCLUS.[280]
line: When youthful rivals their full force extend,

Poem Title: FUNERAL GAMES IN HONOUR OF PATROCLUS.[280]
line: So far, Antilochus! thy chariot flew

Poem Title: FUNERAL GAMES IN HONOUR OF PATROCLUS.[280]
line: Before the king: he, cautious, backward drew

Poem Title: FUNERAL GAMES IN HONOUR OF PATROCLUS.[280]
line: His horse compell’d; foreboding in his fears

Poem Title: FUNERAL GAMES IN HONOUR OF PATROCLUS.[280]
line: The rattling ruin of the clashing cars,

Poem Title: FUNERAL GAMES IN HONOUR OF PATROCLUS.[280]
line: The floundering coursers rolling on the plain,

Poem Title: FUNERAL GAMES IN HONOUR OF PATROCLUS.[280]
line: And conquest lost through frantic haste to gain.

Poem Title: FUNERAL GAMES IN HONOUR OF PATROCLUS.[280]
line: But thus upbraids his rival as he flies:

Poem Title: FUNERAL GAMES IN HONOUR OF PATROCLUS.[280]
line: “Go, furious youth! ungenerous and unwise!

Poem Title: FUNERAL GAMES IN HONOUR OF PATROCLUS.[280]
line: Go, but expect not I’ll the prize resign;

Poem Title: FUNERAL GAMES IN HONOUR OF PATROCLUS.[280]
line: Add perjury to fraud, and make it thine—”

Poem Title: FUNERAL GAMES IN HONOUR OF PATROCLUS.[280]
line: Then to his steeds with all his force he cries,

Poem Title: FUNERAL GAMES IN HONOUR OF PATROCLUS.[280]
line: “Be swift, be vigorous, and regain the prize!

Poem Title: FUNERAL GAMES IN HONOUR OF PATROCLUS.[280]
line: Your rivals, destitute of youthful force,

Poem Title: FUNERAL GAMES IN HONOUR OF PATROCLUS.[280]
line: With fainting knees shall labour in the course,

Poem Title: FUNERAL GAMES IN HONOUR OF PATROCLUS.[280]
line: And yield the glory yours.”—The steeds obey;

Poem Title: FUNERAL GAMES IN HONOUR OF PATROCLUS.[280]
line: Already at their heels they wing their way,

Poem Title: FUNERAL GAMES IN HONOUR OF PATROCLUS.[280]
line: And seem already to retrieve the day.

Poem Title: FUNERAL GAMES IN HONOUR OF PATROCLUS.[280]
FUNERAL GAMES IN HONOUR OF PATROCLUS.[280]
line: Meantime the Grecians in a ring beheld

Poem Title: FUNERAL GAMES IN HONOUR OF PATROCLUS.[280]
line: The coursers bounding o’er the dusty field.

Poem Title: FUNERAL GAMES IN HONOUR OF PATROCLUS.[280]
line: The first who mark’d them was the Cretan king;

Poem Title: FUNERAL GAMES IN HONOUR OF PATROCLUS.[280]
line: High on a rising ground, above the ring,

Poem Title: FUNERAL GAMES IN HONOUR OF PATROCLUS.[280]
line: The monarch sat: from whence with sure survey

Poem Title: FUNERAL GAMES IN HONOUR OF PATROCLUS.[280]
line: He well observed the chief who led the way,

Poem Title: FUNERAL GAMES IN HONOUR OF PATROCLUS.[280]
line: And heard from far his animating cries,

Poem Title: FUNERAL GAMES IN HONOUR OF PATROCLUS.[280]
line: And saw the foremost steed with sharpen’d eyes;

Poem Title: FUNERAL GAMES IN HONOUR OF PATROCLUS.[280]
line: On whose broad front a blaze of shining white,

Poem Title: FUNERAL GAMES IN HONOUR OF PATROCLUS.[280]
line: Like the full moon, stood obvious to the sight.

Poem Title: FUNERAL GAMES IN HONOUR OF PATROCLUS.[280]
line: He saw; and rising, to the Greeks begun:

Poem Title: FUNERAL GAMES IN HONOUR OF PATROCLUS.[280]
line: “Are yonder horse discern’d by me alone?

Poem Title: FUNERAL GAMES IN HONOUR OF PATROCLUS.[280]
line: Or can ye, all, another chief survey,

Poem Title: FUNERAL GAMES IN HONOUR OF PATROCLUS.[280]
line: And other steeds than lately led the way?
